title: BelongMS Improving life with Multiple Sclerosis
description:
The BelongMS app provides people with Multiple Sclerosis and their families a unique and innovative personalized solution to help manage MS and improve their quality of  life.

Using BelongMS, you will find support and professional groups for people living with Multiple Sclerosis.
The FREE service includes:
- Access to leading medical professionals who answer your questions.
- Assistance, tips, and support from a vast social network of others living with MS.
- The ability to organize and manage your records on your mobile device, and share easily with family and medical professionals.
- The ability to personalize information and notifications. ¬†
- Access to a robust clinical trial matching service specific to your type of MS.

BelongMS is an information sharing platform between users, healthcare stake holders and publicly available information. BelongMS does not recommend, provide, suggest or deliver advice of any kind.

comments: I'm not a fan of the internet. I've been hacked & hit w/ viruses repeatedly... So I don't use this ALL that much. But when I do I find lovely helpful folks to talk with and I am grateful. üíï NOW the MS is kicking my rear. I just had MRI'S last week head & spine and get to wait till Tues. for results. The waiting... üò≥Even though we KNOW it's worse. Anyone else question why you bother going in for the MRI'S every year just to get the bad news that makes your emotional health & stress 100% worse?
I love there is a spot to be able to chat with fellow people on are good thoughts as well as hard times or just plain ask anything & someone might have a good insight on it.
Best and most active support network I've experienced thus far! Great for chatting with others the same as me.
Its great to connect with other people going through the same challenges as me. Lots of useful information.

I think so amazing that for certain apps that do all kinds of amazing things this one I thought it was just about exercise but I also gives you great comments and you get great experiences and learn from it.

title: Emilyn - My MS Companion (Multiple Sclerosis)
description:
Make your life easier and take control of your health with Emilyn 

Emilyn is a free app that was designed in partnership with over 1,500 people with MS. It is there to make life easier and improve how you manage your condition.

It's packed full of features to help you understand your symptoms, beat your brain fog and have more productive conversations with your doctor. 

Since its launch in April 2019 Emilyn has improved the lives of over 15,000 people with multiple sclerosis. 

"This app is absolutely brilliant to log your daily symptoms, you can set reminders for appointment, meds and to fill out your days symptoms, just really brilliant"
Tamsin - Emilyn user 
‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê

"Love this app! Takes only a few minutes to log your daily MS symptoms making it possible to see weeks or months of symptom patterns"
Linda - Emilyn user 
‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê

"So easy to use really helps me to get the most out of my doctors appointments especially when I am having an off-day"
Sam - Emilyn user 
‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê

üìä Symptom trackingüìä 
Daily check-in to log your mood and symptom severity on a 1-5 scale
Add notes to your check-in to give additional details
Generate downloadable PDF reports to share with your doctor
Add step count and weather data to see their impact on you 

 ‚è∞ Customisable reminders ‚è∞ 
Medication or treatment reminders
Daily check-in reminder 
Upcoming appointment reminders

 üë©‚Äç‚öïÔ∏è Appointment preparation üë©‚Äç‚öïÔ∏è 
Review your reports and notes before your medical appointment
Prepare to discuss any triggers or new symptoms
Decide on new treatment options if necessary

 üìã Healthcare record storage üìã 
Securely store your healthcare records and doctors notes
Take photos of paperwork and store it in one place

 üîúComing soon üîú  
Find research opportunities relevant to you

üîí You stay in control of your health data üîí

All of your data and health records are encrypted on your phone.
Only you can see them and only you can decide to share them. 
You can edit or delete anything you upload at any time. 

---

Emilyn is currently the number one multiple sclerosis app on the Google Play store.

We are always working hard on making Emilyn even better, and would love to hear from you. Feel free to reach out to us with suggestions or comments by emailing info@emilyn.app. 

Download Emilyn, your free multiple sclerosis companion app, today!

comments: Have been using this app for a few days now to log symptoms, and it's certainly helping me build a habit of doing so. I've found it quicker and easier to use than other apps, perhaps as it's more geared to MS rather than a general health app. I'm looking forward to being able to collate my logs fory next appointment as previously always forgotten to mention something.

Only started to use this but it's keeping me on track it's detailed in what your symptoms are and how severe they are, so everyday it's pretty easy to chart everything that I'm experiencing and I found it really helpful
Love this app, it is perfect for tracking all of my MS symptoms so that I can be prepared for my doctor's appointments!.
A really good app especially for people who like myself with terrible memories to be able to keep records of how life is for them.
Helpful tracking of symptoms and pain/issue diary made monitoring my condition much easier.

title: Multiple Sclerosis Advice
description: In Multiple Sclerosis Advice you can find simple guidelines to improve your quality of life. What to eat, workouts and lifestyle changes to improve your well-being. Multiple Sclerosis Advice is simple and easy to use. A good reminder for all Multiple Sclerosis patients. Combine a good diet (avoid artificial foods), good routines, and gentle workouts and you can start seeing improvements in your daily life.

summary: Advice to improve your Multiple Sclerosis with natural methods.
recentChanges: Healthy habits for patients now on 32-bit and 64-bit
comments: this is pretty good advice especially for someone who was just diagnosed like myself. thank you
Seems pretty self-explanatory, probably more suited to someone newly diagnosed. Nothing on here that I didn't know past 6 years. Foods section literally applies to anyone, not just those with MS
Good info on ms and foods
There are same foods in 'yes' and also 'no' group such as alcohol(red wine) and yoghurt. Maybe it should be clarified a bit more?
Missing way too much important information. Has some wrong information.

title: Multiple Sclerosis Support
description:
MyMSTeam is a social network and support group for those living with multiple sclerosis. Get the emotional support you need from others like you, get practical tips to manage your life with MS, and insights about treatment or therapies. MyMSTeam is the only social network where you can truly connect, make real friendships, and share daily ups and downs in a judgment-free place.

‚úì Keep up and follow members photos & updates
‚úì Quick photo buttons so you don't miss a beat
‚úì Post updates about the daily ups & downs
‚úì Get/Give instant hugs, likes & comments of support
‚úì Search the Q+A section/ask and answer questions
‚úì Add others to your team
‚úì Find others near you and like you
‚úì Add your diagnosis and view others

MyMSTeam is for those living with multiple sclerosis.

Featured on Healthline as one of the years best MS apps!

We welcome your feedback!

Please email us at support@mymsteam.com with your comments & suggestions.

title: Multiple Sclerosis Dx & Mgmt.
description:
The Multiple Sclerosis - Clinical Care App contains current information on the diagnosis, classification, and management of multiple sclerosis (MS), concisely presented for use at the point of care. The content has been developed by Borm Bruckmeier Publishing in collaboration with the National MS Society, and is intended for practicing neurologists, resident physicians and other healthcare professionals involved in the management of patients with multiple sclerosis.

 

Highlights include:

¬∑ Signs and symptoms characteristic of MS

¬∑ Four disease courses

¬∑ 2017 Revised McDonald Diagnostic Criteria for Multiple Sclerosis

¬∑ Differential diagnoses

¬∑ Elements of the diagnostic workup, including typical findings on brain and spinal MRI, and cerebrospinal fluid analysis

¬∑ Common clinically-isolated syndrome presentations

¬∑ Extensive symptom management including impact on quality of life, additional resources, and patient education material

¬∑ Treatment strategies including disease-modifying medications and relapse and symptom management

¬∑ Assessment scales including the Kurtzke Functional Systems Scores, Kurtzke Expanded Disability Status Scale, Bladder Control Scale, and Two-Question Screening Tool for Depression

¬∑ National MS Society resources for clinicians and their patients

 


Disclaimer:

You should not use the information contained herein for diagnosing a health or fitness problem or disease. You should always consult with a doctor or other health care professional for medical advice or information about diagnosis and treatment before making a medical decision. By using this app, you acknowledge and understand that this app is not constantly monitored and if you are in need of immediate medical attention, you should immediately call 9-1-1.

title: icompanion ‚Äì track, test and understand your MS
description:
icompanion is a free (no in-app purchases, no advertisement) app and webplatform (icompanion.ms) that helps you with the home monitoring of your condition. In between your doctor‚Äôs visit, a lot of information is lost: how you feel, which symptoms you experience, how strong these are, how your disability, fatigue and cognition are changing, etc. The app is currently available in üá∫üá∏ üá¨üáß  English, üá©üá™  German, üá´üá∑  French, üáßüá™ üá≥üá±  Dutch, üáÆüáπ  Italian and üá™üá∏  Spanish.

For all of this, you‚Äôve got a companion in me! Unlike most of the other health apps, icompanion is a registered medical device. Hence, the information you monitor with icompanion can be used by your doctor to make decisions on your health. If you log-in at icompanion.ms with the same account information, you can share your icompanion information with your doctor. This can lead to more productive conversations and there is more information at hand for your doctor on how you‚Äôve been doing.

icompanion is very easy to use, yet full of relevant information for you. In only a few minutes a day, you will have an overview of:
‚úì your daily mood
‚úì Any notes you wish to add
‚úì All your treatments, therapies, etc
‚úì The symptoms you‚Äôre experiencing over time
‚úì The severity of these symptoms

In addition, icompanion contains clinical tests that have been developed by the largest academic centers and that are used worldwide to monitor Multiple Sclerosis. These tests evaluate:
‚úì Your level of disability, through the patient reported ‚ÄòExpanded Disability Status Scale (EDSS)‚Äô
‚úì Your cognitive abilities, through the neuro quality of life (neuro-qol) questionnaire on cognition
‚úì Your level of fatigue, through the neuro quality of life (neuro-qol) questionnaire on fatigue

Furthermore, icompanion allows you to upload your MRI scans to the webplatform (icompanion.ms). In this way, you can easily store all your medical scans in one secure and central space. You can scroll through your own brain scan in several directions and learn about what MRI can show (and what it doesn‚Äôt). 

icompanion also includes a knowledge center, with relevant information that is explained. All of this together will help you to prepare for your doctor‚Äôs visit.

Take charge of your condition, monitor how you feel, track your health: let icompanion be your companion. 

The icompanion team wants to learn your story and your ideas! Share them via support@icompanion.com.

title: MS Notes Journal
description:
If you live with multiple sclerosis, this app will help you to keep a record of notes relating to your condition. You will be able to record your good days, your bad days, and anything you want to discuss with your healthcare professionals.

You can also upgrade to premium to unlock charting; this will enable you to visualize your data, see your most common symptoms, and keep track of how your symptoms have increased or decreased over time.

comments: Really like the extensive categories, its very comprehensive. Like having many data points to log, weather, happiness, duration, and notes to add any additional. Would like to see sections for food journal, vitamins, sleep (fitbit integration would be great) and intensity of symptom and treatment applied with degree of relief. Would also like push notifications as reminder to log. Allowing user to set push reminder schedule would also be very nice. Graph feature would be helpful in identifying trends and dr contact info, med alert details in case of emergency.
Very good and useful. Would be even better if you had categories for Nutrition and/or Diet. Currently I have to enter these under Other. Thank you.

Very simple to use and allows me to describe my symptoms in detail.
only issue is you cant send info anywhere but microsoft cloud, I use google..

title: Multiple Sclerosis App 1
description:
All About Multiple Sclerosis


What is it?



It has been scientifically determined that multiple sclerosis can potentially debilitate a person. This means that the body‚Äôs own immune system attacks the sheath that protects the nerves.



Once this sheath is damaged or totally destroyed, the normal communication between the person‚Äôs brain and the rest of the body is interfered. This condition results into the deteriorating of the nerves, a complication that can never be reversed.



Its symptoms



The symptoms of multiple sclerosis may vary depending on how much damage has occurred to the nerves that are affected. Those who have the severe type of multiple sclerosis can end up being bedridden since their ability to walk or to talk is destroyed.¬†



What is very bothersome about these symptoms is that they tend to come and go. This means that they could suddenly arrive and then suddenly disappear for a few months. This is why doctors find it initially difficult to diagnose multiple sclerosis during its early stages.



Multiple sclerosis symptoms are also usually manifested by people between the ages of twenty and forty. Although multiple sclerosis can happen to anyone from any age, this is the common age range that is affected. Also, according to statistical research, the women are the ones who usually carry this debilitating disorder.



There is numbness or fatigue in one limb or both. This kind of weakness usually occurs on just one side of the body at a single time.



However, there have been reports that it could happen to the entire bottom part of the body. This condition is often accompanied with a tingling sensation that is sometimes painful in some parts of the body.



There is also a partial or a complete visual loss which starts at one time then ends with having pain whenever both eyes move. This condition is given the medical term of optic neuritis. Apart from loss of vision, double vision or blurring of vision can also occur.



There could also be sensations like electrical shock that occur whenever the head is moved. Tremors also happen with the accompaniment of absence of coordination and imbalanced gait.



Many who have multiple sclerosis might experience relapses of the symptoms, especially during the early stages of the disorder. This relapsing phase is often followed by partial or complete remission.



Its causes



As minimally mentioned, multiple sclerosis is an autoimmune disease. This means that the body‚Äôs immune system attacks its own cells and tissues.



The myelin, which is a protective wall that insulates the nerve fibers within, is damaged in multiple sclerosis. Once it is damaged, foreign substances that are potentially harmful can then freely destroy the open and unprotected nerve fibers.



Multiple sclerosis can happen to anyone from any age. However, it has been discovered that it usually occurs to people who are between twenty and forty years of age.



As mentioned, women are also the ones who usually carry such disease. In fact, women are twice more likely to have multiple sclerosis than men.



As any other condition, heredity plays an important role. The risk of developing multiple sclerosis is greater for those who have a family history of the disease than for those who do not.



If one of the parents has the disease, then there is a one to three percent possibility that multiple sclerosis may develop.



When it comes to identical twins, things are much more complicated and difficult to ascertain. Identical twins would mean having identical risks, according to some medical scientists.



However, this is not the case because a twin who has multiple sclerosis only gives his or her identical twin a thirty percent possibility of having the very same disorder.
descriptionHTML:
All About Multiple Sclerosis


What is it?



It has been scientifically determined that multiple sclerosis can potentially debilitate a person. This means that the body‚Äôs own immune system attacks the sheath that protects the nerves.



Once this sheath is damaged or totally destroyed, the normal communication between the person‚Äôs brain and the rest of the body is interfered. This condition results into the deteriorating of the nerves, a complication that can never be reversed.



Its symptoms



The symptoms of multiple sclerosis may vary depending on how much damage has occurred to the nerves that are affected. Those who have the severe type of multiple sclerosis can end up being bedridden since their ability to walk or to talk is destroyed.¬†



What is very bothersome about these symptoms is that they tend to come and go. This means that they could suddenly arrive and then suddenly disappear for a few months. This is why doctors find it initially difficult to diagnose multiple sclerosis during its early stages.



Multiple sclerosis symptoms are also usually manifested by people between the ages of twenty and forty. Although multiple sclerosis can happen to anyone from any age, this is the common age range that is affected. Also, according to statistical research, the women are the ones who usually carry this debilitating disorder.



There is numbness or fatigue in one limb or both. This kind of weakness usually occurs on just one side of the body at a single time.



However, there have been reports that it could happen to the entire bottom part of the body. This condition is often accompanied with a tingling sensation that is sometimes painful in some parts of the body.



There is also a partial or a complete visual loss which starts at one time then ends with having pain whenever both eyes move. This condition is given the medical term of optic neuritis. Apart from loss of vision, double vision or blurring of vision can also occur.



There could also be sensations like electrical shock that occur whenever the head is moved. Tremors also happen with the accompaniment of absence of coordination and imbalanced gait.



Many who have multiple sclerosis might experience relapses of the symptoms, especially during the early stages of the disorder. This relapsing phase is often followed by partial or complete remission.



Its causes



As minimally mentioned, multiple sclerosis is an autoimmune disease. This means that the body‚Äôs immune system attacks its own cells and tissues.



The myelin, which is a protective wall that insulates the nerve fibers within, is damaged in multiple sclerosis. Once it is damaged, foreign substances that are potentially harmful can then freely destroy the open and unprotected nerve fibers.



Multiple sclerosis can happen to anyone from any age. However, it has been discovered that it usually occurs to people who are between twenty and forty years of age.



As mentioned, women are also the ones who usually carry such disease. In fact, women are twice more likely to have multiple sclerosis than men.



As any other condition, heredity plays an important role. The risk of developing multiple sclerosis is greater for those who have a family history of the disease than for those who do not.



If one of the parents has the disease, then there is a one to three percent possibility that multiple sclerosis may develop.



When it comes to identical twins, things are much more complicated and difficult to ascertain. Identical twins would mean having identical risks, according to some medical scientists.



However, this is not the case because a twin who has multiple sclerosis only gives his or her identical twin a thirty percent possibility of having the very same disorder.
summary: Up to now, multiple sclerosis is still idiopathic.
recentChanges: Download this app now!

title: Yoga vs. MS: Yoga against Multiple Sclerosis
description:
Yoga vs. MS is an app which offers up to 30 yoga positions that can help you manage some of the side effects commonly associated to this condition, including:
- Fatigue and a general feeling of weakness
- Issues with balance and falling
- Pain associated with swelling
- Mood swings, anxiety, depression and nervousness
- Temperature control, mostly through pranayama and breathing exercises

This app was developed by identifying common side effects related to Multiple Sclerosis and looking for yoga positions that could help alleviate them. It is free for any patient who wants to use it. Just click on the text to go to the next screen.

Disclaimer: Yoga is in no way a substitute for medication prescribed by doctors nor will it cure serious illness by itself. Its practice is meant to help us to better know and control our bodies.

title: Multiple Sclerosis Messenger
description:
Multiple Sclerosis Messenger

Simple App..that allows patient message their current symptoms
out to contacts.

This can be instantly shared with health care providers such as an MS nurse,
neurologist, chiropractor, or MS carer, family member etc.

Further releases of this app with additional features will be available in near future.

Personal : This app is dedicated to Caroline who we lost to MS..
As her caregiver I felt I wanted to develop this for other sufferers with
this disease...Hope you find it helpful.

See also sister apps..Multiple Sclerosis ( for symptoms) and Multiple Sclerosis Chat.

Software Developer: Andrew Cason, London, U.K.
KingfishApps
https://kingfishapps.wordpress.com/

title: Multiple Sclerosis Chat
description:
Allows Multiple Sclerosis Patients to chat with each other
can be used by ms carers, nurses, patients, doctors  etc
can upload photos. 

This is a very basic chat but in near future releases will have extra features.

Please note this is a new app ( Sep 2017) so would take time to build up an MS community of users who wish to make friends, share experiences, learn from each other etc. The success depends on how much demand there is.

Personal : This app is dedicated to Caroline who we lost to MS..
As her caregiver I felt I wanted to develop this for other sufferers with
this disease...Hope you find it helpful. 

Awarded best ms apps 2018.
https://www.healthline.com/health/multiple-sclerosis/top-iphone-android-apps#multiple-sclerosis-chat

Also try our app called "Multiple Sclerosis"  a repository  for MS symptoms.
and "Multiple Sclerosis Messenger"

Software Developer: Andrew Cason, London, U.K.
KingfishApps
https://kingfishapps.wordpress.com/

The app also provides information on the UT MS Clinic, and the Neuro Eye Center.

title: My MS Manager‚Ñ¢
description:
Welcome to the new and improved My MS Manager‚Ñ¢, a free mobile application created by the Multiple Sclerosis Association of America (MSAA) in partnership with @Point of Care for individuals with multiple sclerosis (MS) and/or their care partner. 

Future app updates include a daily newsfeed and an area to input Injection Site information.

This convenient and effective tool is designed to help you manage your MS, consistent with MSAA‚Äôs mission of improving lives today.

Need help getting the app? Have feedback? Call 1-800-772-8277, ext 178 to get assistance.

If you have questions about MS that are not related to this App, please e-mail Msquestions@mymsaa.org or call 1-800-532-7667, ext. 154, for assistance.

recentChanges:
Added Featured Content functionality.
Added Biometric login functionality.
Updated analytics.
Resolved reported issues.
Resolved Symptoms issue.
comments: Scrolled back through the years over 500 times to get to my DOB when creating an account, entered all my info, then hit done. Took me to the login page and it says I don't exist. Uninstalled the app. This seemed like a good app to have, but it is pretty useless.

Super frustrating!!! I've got to log in once and start adding information, now it will not accept my user email or password. It seems to be common error by looking at other reviews. I want to use this - but now I can't.....
Had difficulty getting signed up at first, but got help from the developers and everything is working. Great program for keeping track of my MS symptoms daily. Just started, mire to explore.

I logged in a new account. Saw positive aspects. Cant list all of my supplement ms meds....meh then the 2nd day it wouldn't let me log in and said I didn't exist. Frustrating for this glitch much less to log in each time. My stupid games auto log in .... I erased the app after that which stinks as it had potential.

I couldn't even get past the registration stage. This app has to be the worst ever! Do yourself a favor and don't bother downloading. UPDATE I try and complete the registration and put all required information but it comes back invalid.

title: MS Kognition

Die √úbungen von MS Kognition wurden zusammen mit Experten entwickelt und bieten spezielle wissenschaftlich fundierte √úbungen zu folgenden Bereichen:

- Aufmerksamkeit: Fokussierte und geteilte Aufmerksamkeit
- Ged√§chtnis: Arbeitsged√§chtnis, Langzeitged√§chtnis, Namensged√§chtnis

Die App eignet sich nicht nur f√ºr MS-Erkrankte, sondern f√ºr all jene, die spielerisch allgemeine alltagsrelevante kognitive F√§higkeiten trainieren und verbessern wollen.

MS Kognition wurde von der unabh√§ngigen Patientenorganisation Deutsche Multiple Sklerose Gesellschaft, Bundesverband e. V. title: Aby
description:
Meet Aby, an app created for people living with MS & the people who support them.
With Aby, you will have:
* Access to a Nurse Educator to answer questions you may have about living with Multiple Sclerosis
* Tailored content to find tips, inspiration and news related to multiple sclerosis
* A personal journal to keep track of your health, visualize your data and share reports with your healthcare team
* Wellness programs designed by healthcare professionals tailored to your specific needs Remember, your healthcare team should always be your primary source for any information or questions.
We understand that living with Multiple Sclerosis may present unique challenges that others do not typically face on a daily basis. Meet Aby, your digital MS app and support companion! Aby was designed for people living with MS and the people who support them. With Aby, you will have access to a variety of tools and resources, conveniently accessible in one app. Our goal is to provide a valuable MS app to help you and your healthcare team. We‚Äôre here to support you along your journey ‚Äì and now, anywhere you are.
KEY FEATURES:
1. Access to a Nurse Educator to answer questions you may have about multiple sclerosis
2. Tailored content to find tips, inspiration and news related to multiple sclerosis
3. A personal journal to keep track of your health, visualize your data and share reports with your healthcare team
4. Wellness programs designed by healthcare professionals tailored to your specific needs
NURSE EDUCATOR SUPPORT
Connect with Nurse Educators who have extensive knowledge of MS, directly in the app. While your healthcare team should be your primary source of information for any questions or concerns you may have, our Nurse Educators are also available to answer your MS-related questions.
MS-RELATED INFORMATION
Explore articles and videos with tips for living with MS, suggestions for staying active, information about common MS symptoms, and MS disease education. Customize the type of content you‚Äôre interested in seeing for a more personalized experience.
PERSONAL JOURNAL
When your healthcare team better understands what goes on between appointments, you can make better treatment decisions together. Aby can help you keep track of your moods, symptoms, physical activities, and more. Link Aby to your Google Fit to track steps and distance. Then create reports to share and discuss with your healthcare team.
APPOINTMENT & MEDICATION REMINDERS
We all have a lot of our minds, so use Aby to help provide reminders for you throughout the day. Set up appointment and medication notifications based on schedules discussed with your healthcare team.
WELLNESS PROGRAMS
Access different exercise and wellness programs. We worked with healthcare specialists to create exercise programs that have people living with MS in mind. After talking to your healthcare team, you can choose from different levels of intensity based on your ability and comfort level. Remember, everyone‚Äôs experience with MS is different, and your healthcare team should always be your primary source for any information about your MS.
Remember, your healthcare team should always be your primary source for any information or questions.

Explore articles and videos with tips for living with MS, suggestions for staying active, information about common MS symptoms, and MS disease education. Customize the type of content you‚Äôre interested in seeing for a more personalized experience.
PERSONAL JOURNAL
When your healthcare team better understands what goes on between appointments, you can make better treatment decisions together. Aby can help you keep track of your moods, symptoms, physical activities, and more. Link Aby to your Google Fit to track steps and distance. Then create reports to share and discuss with your healthcare team.
APPOINTMENT & MEDICATION REMINDERS
We all have a lot of our minds, so use Aby to help provide reminders for you throughout the day. Set up appointment and medication notifications based on schedules discussed with your healthcare team.
WELLNESS PROGRAMS
Access different exercise and wellness programs. We worked with healthcare specialists to create exercise programs that have people living with MS in mind. After talking to your healthcare team, you can choose from different levels of intensity based on your ability and comfort level. Remember, everyone‚Äôs experience with MS is different, and your healthcare team should always be your primary source for any information about your MS.
Remember, your healthcare team should always be your primary source for any information or questions.

comments: Good app for information. But when I click on programs, it appears to go to selections, but nothing happens when i click on it. And for the person who thought the site was asking for your email password, you must have been in a fog at the time....it is just asking you to enter a password for this app!
Just downloaded and went to sign up... why do they need the password for my email? Nope. Stopped right there.
loving that there are ms related exercises!! has been able to get me moving again.
Very helpful and easy to navigate!!

So far, this is the best app I've found to help keep track to my ms stuff. It could definitely be better though. Things like being able to add/edit the symptoms we would like to track, adding goes in the mediation reminders and being to add a pic or two of the meds we are taking would be great steps towards improving the apps. The "informational" articles aren't very informative- they mostly introduce you to a topic for you to do further research on if your interested.

title: Healthstories - Multiple Sclerosis (MS)
description:
Introducing Healthstories for Multiple Sclerosis (MS), an innovative new health tool that allows you to always keep track of your multiple sclerosis symptoms and share them as stories to friends and caregivers!
 
Creating a Healthstory is the easiest way to build a story about your symptoms, providing a deeper look at how you‚Äôre doing. Each time you experience a symptom, write a quick note about it and add it to a Healthstory. Over time your Healthstory will get bigger, allowing you to get a complete look at how you‚Äôre really feeling. You can create custom stories about any topic, and keep adding to them on a daily basis.
 
Want to show others how you feel? Our dynamic sharing feature allows you to send your story to friends and caregivers whenever you like! Start your story, and build your first Healthstory today!
 
Questions or comments, email us: jake@healthstories.co

title: Bearable - Symptoms & Mood tracker
description:
‚úÖ All health tracking in one place

Tired of juggling multiple apps to keep track of your mood, symptoms, sleep, exercise, diet, and medication? We think all of this should be kept in one convenient place so that you and your health professional can get the full picture.

‚úÖ Reclaim control over your well-being

Bearable empowers people to reclaim control over their well-being by making mood and symptom tracking simple, convenient, and accessible to all. Making entries in our health diary is quick and effortless, so you can focus more energy on getting better.  

The app has been shaped by our community of thousands of people with varying chronic health issues.

‚úÖ Gain useful insights with just a few clicks a day

With just a few simple clicks each day our intelligent health diary can help you to gain insights into which daily activities and health factors are positively and negatively affecting your mental and physical health.


Bearable helps you to:

‚úîÔ∏è Record your mood and symptoms in seconds, or go into more detail with an additional note. 
‚úîÔ∏è Fully customise your daily activities and health factors, such as sleep, diet, exercise and medication/supplements. 
‚úîÔ∏è Gain insights into how your daily activities and health factors impact your mood and symptoms using our graphs, calendar and stats pages.
‚úîÔ∏è Keep everything in one place with our neat health timeline, so that you can get the full picture. Use our search function to filter just what you want to see or show your health professional.
‚úîÔ∏è Come prepared to your next doctor or therapist appointment - no need to struggle to remember a detailed health timeline for the last week or month.
‚úîÔ∏è Make journaling a healthy habit with our quick, simple and enjoyable entry process.

And there‚Äôs much more‚Ä¶

‚ûï Set Reminders - Fully customise your reminders, whether it's a general reminder to make a diary entry or a reminder to take your medication and supplements. 
‚ûï Share and Export -  Export data securely to yourself or your health professional
‚ûï Automatic health data sync - You can choose to allow the app to automatically gather data such as Sleep and Steps taken from your phone.
‚ûï Dark mode - Change at night to a display easier on the eyes.
‚ûï Restore data across devices - Restore your data between Apple & Android devices.


üîê PRIVATE & SECURE

Rest easy knowing your data is encrypted securely on our servers. You have full control over your data and can delete it from within the app at any time.  It‚Äôs important to emphasise that we will never under any circumstances sell any personal data to anyone.


üíü MADE BY PEOPLE WHO UNDERSTAND AND CARE

Created by individuals who have lived with mental and physical health issues themselves.  With feedback and feature requests from a research group of thousands of people with a wide variety of chronic diseases and health conditions, including Anxiety, Depression, CFS (ME), MS (Multiple Sclerosis), Fibromyalgia, Endometriosis, Bipolar, BPD, PTSD, Migraines, Headaches, Vertigo, Cancer (Chemo Symptoms), Arthritis, Crohns, Diabetes, IBS and IBD.  Our aim is to make our symptom tracker simple and accessible to everyone, even if suffering from the fatigue and brain fog that often accompanies many conditions.

We have created a real sense of community around Bearable and will continue to listen closely to those who need it most.  We are committed to continue improving upon this app that could help many people start to feel like they can reclaim control over their health.  If you have any questions, feedback or feature requests, please send them over to james@bearable.app.  We‚Äôd love to hear from you.




Credit to Freepik for icons

comments: This is absolutely the best of its kind. I have never seen such a comprehensive, customizable, well-designed app that serves as many functions as this one. I've already shown it to multiple friends/therapists. For those of you moaning about the cost... seriously, getting the subscription will set you back just over $2/month. I work professionally with highly impoverished individuals who do have to count every penny, but come on. Most people can shell out a couple bucks without harm.

The app lets you log your mood, any symptoms you are having, and a number of factors that you think may be affecting your mood/symptoms. The default categories to log are good, but you can add/remove/edit all of the categories to fit you better. It's super easy to fill out, even when I'm not feeling well. It (sometimes) feels like I'm logging meaningless information, but then when I click on the Insights tab, it shows me tons of relevant information about which factors are influencing my mood (or any other symptom I log!). Turns out listening to music and video chats work wonders for my mood--good to know! This is also a wonderful way to record how I'm feeling over time--it lets me easily decipher long-term changes in my wellbeing, which is great information to discuss with medical professionals.

I really like this app, it's easy to use and the design is nice and the ability to customize it to your needs is great. However, the syncing isn't very reliable. I have a phone and a tablet, and downloaded it on both, I tried to log in on the tablet, and only a few entries were visible. Later I went to look at the one on my phone, and half the entries are gone, and so are factors I added. I want to keep using this app, but if it's going to randomly forget things that's a problem.

I have tried multiple times in the past to find a way that I could easily log my moods in a way that felt nuanced and meaningful but also flexible and customizable, but this is the first app I have ever seen that got it right. For once, I am finding it convenient to do quick check ins and even monitor my food and water intake which I never thought I'd have the patience to do. You don't have to get premium, but it's well worth it at least to support a great app.

Brilliant App & well worth paying for. I wanted an app to record daily symptoms to enable me to give an accurate report to my GP. This app has everything I wanted & more. Being able to write notes by each symptom is so helpful & the insight reports are incredible. I did have a little snag when I first signed up for the free trial, but I made contact, explained the situation & James helped me to sort it all out. The app has been fantastic ever since. Thank you bearable team üôèüèªü•∞

title: My Multiple Sclerosis Diary
description:
The app tracks the injection sites automatically and  manage stock of injections.

It can be used for people with multiple sclerosis that are using Copaxone, Avonex, Rebif or other injectable medicines like Insulin. 
This application can be beneficial to people with multiple sclerosis (MS), diabetes, or other medical conditions.

Just fill out a quick and simple registration and will have access to:
* Alarm for removing the medicinal product from the refrigerator ; (Optional)
* Alarm for the injection and their local body area where the injection should be given; (Optional)
* Notifications for when you are approaching the date of the end on your stock of medicines; (Optional)
* Notepad to write down your consultations, medication details and any other situation you don't want to forget;

The app at this time only works for medication that are taken daily, once a week or static days of the week.
Email if you have any questions or suggestions.

comments: This app was great at first, but then the alarm stopped. Then it started repeating injection sites, i injected the same area too many times due to the app. i have now gone back to manual tracking as the app is unreliable. The alarm doesn't work and the tracking is off. You can scroll ahead to see up coming injection sites, but I would like to scroll back and see previous sites so I don't accidentally inject twice. It woild also be nice to skip a site and have the app suggest a new site.

I really like this app, it helps me keep track of my daily injection sites and the alarms work well. I also really appreciate the supply reminder. The only complaints I have are that the note section is not in English and the rotation site glitches sometimes so its reading the incorrect injection site.

Completely useless. You cant change where you gave the shot or make any notes on side effects. You have to use another app to keep track of any other meds. Just a complete waste of time trying to use this
I didn't get past programming my injection sites because the belly isn't listed.
This is a great app, it really helps me to remember what area is inject myself, plus it's a timer.

title: CogniFit- Test & Brain Games
description:
CogniFit offers a scientific patented technology and it is recognized as a global leader in the  Cognitive Assessment & Training Market. CogniFit offers scientifically validated brain fitness solutions. - Join CogniFit, an experienced and authoritative provider of digital brain training games and brain tests. This app offers engaging games to evaluate and train memory, concentration, attention, mental arithmetic, executive functions, reasoning, planning, mental agility, coordination, and more.

CogniFit is a leading interactive mental game application that helps stimulate cognitive skills through personalized daily training. Compare your cognitive skills with the rest of the global population and activate your brain with brain challenges, memory games, puzzles, ingenious games, and much more!

IT INCLUDES:
‚óè Personalized Brain Training programs designed to help train your brain.
‚óè Mental challenges and exercises that test logic and problem-solving skills.
‚óè More than 20 mental games created to improve memory, attention, coordination, reasoning, and more. 
‚óè Personalized daily mental agility exercises and games focused on stimulating cognitive abilities based on your cognitive profile results.
‚óè Mental exercises and challenges specific to children and adults.
‚óè Detailed tracking of user progress and performance
...and much more!


DEVELOPED BY NEUROSCIENTIFIC EXPERTS

Choosing applications with scientifically-validated activities, such as those offered by CogniFit ‚Äî an app created by experts in neuroscience ‚Äî is critical for properly evaluating and training brain functions.

This application is easy to use and accessible for a wide range of users. The application adapts automatically to the specific cognitive needs of each user, from children 7 years old, to adults, and even seniors.

Effective technology used by the scientific community, universities, hospitals, families, and medical centers around the world. 

Terms and Conditions: https://www.cognifit.com/terms-and-conditions
Privacy Policy: https://www.cognifit.com/privacy-policy

comments: I really, really enjoy the app... But I bought the subscription for a year, and it never loaded. The exact dollar amount was taken off my debt card. I'm giving it 4 stars, when normally I would 1 star an app for taking my money. However, their customer support is outstanding!! ü§ó üíï
This was recommended to me. I am interested in cognitive health. It was fun and engaging. I can see the benefit of interacting with these games everyday. I want to do more.
I think it will help me over time. Sometimes the instructions is a little confusing but if do some of the "practice games" then I find that it helps me. Thank you

I'm giving this app 4 stars, because it doesn't know what social well being is, Social well being as how will you socialize with people, you don't have to live with family, have a job, or do Oragami with paper in this case, and you don't have to be a student to have a really good social life. Therefore, I believe CogniFits psychological report on me is not correct in regards to socialisation only, the rest, however cannot be more true.
I like the app. The only thing that truely bothers me is that there is not a mute button/setting to mute the music while playing the games.

title: Carenity
description:
Carenity is a social network for patients affected by a chronic disease and their caregivers. Diabetes, cancer, multiple sclerosis, fibromyalgia, Crohn‚Äôs disease, obesity, depression‚Ä¶

You cannot seem to find relevant answers to your questions? You are feeling misunderstood? You are not alone! Carenity has an active community for every disease.

Download the app and join the community!

SHARE WITH PEOPLE LIKE YOU
  - Tell your story 
  - Make new friends who understand what you are going through
  - Talk to those who have real experience with an illness
  - Share tips and advice on how to live a better life with the disease
  - Take part in discussions on health-related topics of your choice
  - Improve your everyday life and that of others
  - Give and receive support during difficult times

GET INFORMED ABOUT THE CONDITION
  - Find answers to your questions
  - Receive health news related to your disease
  - Discover other patients‚Äô stories 
  - Do an interview about your life with the disease
  - Ask healthcare experts questions about your condition
  - Access the videos that have answers to your questions
  - Share healthy recipes with those who have the same dietary constraints

GIVE YOUR OPINION ON MEDICAL CARE
  - Assess the effectiveness of your treatments 
  - Discover what other members think about the side effects of the medications you are 
  - taking
  - Take surveys to help medical knowledge advance
  - Receive the results of the surveys you take
  - Get enrolled in clinical trials to accelerate medical research

title: MSCorner Health Manager: Track Symptoms & Meds
description:
Welcome to MSCorner!


Managing multiple sclerosis (MS) is a challenge, but MSCorner puts all the tools you need in one place.


From tracking side effects and symptoms to managing medications, MSCorner makes transitioning from paper logs effortless. Make the most of every doctor's visit and stop spending time trying to remember details about your last flare.


Community insights provide real-time feedback into the lifestyle habits that other Warriors have found beneficial. Share what you wish with the community (anonymously if you prefer) and help the knowledge base grow. In the end, we all want to stay healthier and be happier.


Additionally, you will find curated articles into new research on MS medications, lifestyle habits, supplements, and more.


We are always trying to improve your experience and provide the tools you think are most valuable. Don't hesitate to reach out with ideas, thoughts, or just to say hi.


hello@mscorner.com

recentChanges:
Het is nu ook mogelijk om je als naaste of zorgverlener te registeren.
Daarnaast is het nu niet langer nodig om te wachten op een activatiecode voordat je je kunt registeren.

title: MS-Leitfaden f√ºr Neurologen
description:
Eine App f√ºr alle, die mit der Behandlung von Multiple Sklerose Patienten betraut sind.
Ziel dieser App ist es, Neurologen, Studienschwestern, Pflege- und Rehapersonal mit MS-Schwerpunkt eine √ºbersichtliche und strukturierte Arbeitshilfe an die Hand zu geben. Das Kompetenznetz MS tr√§gt damit zu einheitlichen Standards bei Diagnose und Therapie bei. Schrittweise f√ºhrt die Anwendung durch eine SOP zur MS-Erstdiagnose, berechnet automatisch den EDSS-Wert und zeigt im Stufentherapieschema Behandlungsoptionen auf. Sie unterst√ºtzt den Nutzer au√üerdem im Umgang mit den Medikamenten Dimethylfumarat, Teriflunomid, Fingolimod, Natalizumab, Alemtuzumab und Mitoxantron, sowie mit der Schubtherapie und der Therapie in Spezialsituationen. Die App ist hierbei die interaktive Umsetzung der KKNMS-Qualit√§tshandb√ºcher.

Inhalte und Funktionen:

‚Ä¢  via Checkliste zur Erstdiagnose
‚Ä¢  Behinderungsskala: automatische Berechnung des EDSS
‚Ä¢  Stufentherapieschema zur Behandlung von MS
‚Ä¢  Therapie mit Dimethylfumarat, Teriflunomid, Fingolimod, Natalizumab, Alemtuzumab und Mitoxantron, sowie Schubtherapie: 
     -  interaktive Workflowtabelle f√ºhrt durch medizinische Ma√ünahmen, die jeweils vor, w√§hrend oder nach der Therapie notwendig sind
     -  ausf√ºhrliche Erl√§uterungen zur gesamten Behandlung
‚Ä¢  MS-Therapie in Spezialsituationen, z.B. in der Schwangerschaft, auf Reisen oder bei Impfungen

Vorteile:
‚Ä¢  Neuester Stand der Forschung
‚Ä¢  Unabh√§ngige, mit neurologischen Fachgremien abgestimmte Informationen
‚Ä¢  im Offline-Modus verwendbar
‚Ä¢  kostenlos
‚Ä¢  f√ºr iPhone und iPad entwickelt

Die Applikation wurde vom Krankheitsbezogenen Kompetenznetz Multiple Sklerose (KKNMS) realisiert. Autoren des MS-Leitfadens sind renommierte Neurologen aus ganz Deutschland. Die Empfehlungen zur Therapie mit Dimethylfumarat, Teriflunomid, Fingolimod, Natalizumab, Alemtuzumab und Mitoxantron, sowie zur Schubtherapie und zur Therapie in Spezialsituationen entstanden in enger Zusammenarbeit mit dem √Ñrztlichen Beirat der Deutschen Multiple Sklerose Gesellschaft (DMSG), der Deutschen Gesellschaft f√ºr Neurologie (DGN), dem Berufsverband Deutscher Neurologen (BDN) und dem Berufsverband Deutscher Nerven√§rzte (BDVN).

title: BeCare MS Link
description:
The BeCare Link App supports the management of Multiple Sclerosis by collating performance data we believe will be found clinically equivalent to gold standard measurements of neurological and functional status collected by healthcare professionals. To demonstrate this equivalence, BeCare is currently sponsoring a large clinical trial that is being conducted in a major hospital system. The data that the BeCare MS Link App collects is intended to be comparable to the functional data captured by the EDSS (Expanded Disability Status Scale). The Expanded Disability Status Scale (EDSS) is a method of quantifying disability in multiple sclerosis and monitoring changes in the level of disability over time. It is widely used in clinical trials and in the assessment of people with MS and is widely accepted as a valid tool to clinically measure and assess the level of functioning for individuals diagnosed with MS.

In addition to storing functional data on the mobile device, the BeCare Link App is also part of larger process which permanently stores and analyzes this data in the BeCare Link Cloud, through the utilization of machine learning algorithms (MLA‚Äôs). MLA‚Äôs are implemented to produce an EDSS score for each user that is subject to fluctuation over time. Because BeCare Link clinical researchers will be able to analyze data from all users in an aggregate, quantitative process, study participants will be contributing to future advancements of medical treatment of Multiple Sclerosis.

Each time participants connect to the BeCare Link App, a new session is established that can last several hours. After the user completes a substantive number of tasks and activities, a new EDSS score is generated for that session. This EDSS score provided by the clinical trial is compared to EDSS scores that have been previously calculated by healthcare professionals and is then evaluated for accuracy. At any time, BeCare Link app users can view an accumulative history of their performance data in the Readings portion of the app, as well as any other information provided through their voluntary participation, by navigating through the app.

BeCare MS Link Mobile App

The BeCare MS Link mobile app guides the participant to conduct tasks and answer status questions about their symptoms to deliver information tantamount to current gold standards used in clinical studies, applicable to further understanding of MS.

Each activity on the MS Link mobile app has a unique sequence of steps the user must complete that correspond to standard functional tests typically performed by clinicians during neurological assessments. These functions are accomplished through the use the accelerometer, gyroscope and magnetic sensors in the participant‚Äôs phone that determine when the person makes a tilting motion, takes a step, alters their position, or moves their arms.

For example, the App activity initiated by selecting "Transcription Test" from the Wellness Workout landing page measures Central Auditory Processing, or the ability to understand speech. Other activities measured by the BeCare MS Link App include standard motor skills through activities such as walking (25 Steps, 6 Minute Walk), repetitive arm movements (Arm Elevation), or the TUG test, which involves transitioning from a seated position, to standing, walking, and then returning to the starting point.

For each of the activities users complete, the BeCare Link App saves data corresponding to each completed activity on the mobile device. When an internet or WIFI connection from the mobile device to the BeCare Link Cloud becomes available, the BeCare Link App uploads an encrypted representation of the data to the BeCare Link Cloud, where the data is classified by the MLAs to produce an EDSS score. The EDSS scores are kept available so that users can view their historical performance and identify if any changes in their performance history are correlative to the progression of their MS.

title: My MS-UK
description:
New Pathways is the bi-monthly magazine from MS-UK. Each issue contains the latest news on multiple sclerosis studies, information on living with MS and personal stories and testimonies of people living life to the full with MS.

From new drug therapies to revolutionary research, we cover the topics you need to know about. There are no taboo subjects. If it matters to people affected by MS, we‚Äôll be sure to explore it.

And we believe it is important that people can share their stories through New Pathways, which is why we always speak to people living with MS. Real voices matter, and we showcase your opinions in our letters page and regular reader surveys.

There are also opportunities to get involved. Whether you enjoy fundraising, volunteering or would like to write an article for us, all of the details are in the magazine.

Established in 1993, MS-UK is a national charity dedicated to empowering people with multiple sclerosis to make the most of today, and live life to the full.

title: MS Tagebuch
description:
MS Tagebuch ist ein Symptom-Tagebuch f√ºr Patienten mit Multipler Sklerose. Mit der praktischen App k√∂nnen Sie Ihre Symptome kontinuierlich dokumentieren und so Ihren Alltag besser bew√§ltigen lernen: MS Tagebuch erleichtert es Ihnen, Zusammenh√§nge zwischen t√§glichen Tiefs/Hochs und der jeweiligen Situation zur erkennen und Ihren Tagesablauf inkl. ben√∂tigter Pausen entsprechend darauf anzupassen. Au√üerdem dient das √ºbersichtliche Dokumentieren Ihrer Symptome als wertvolle Grundlage f√ºr Ihren n√§chsten Arztbesuch im Hinblick auf eine eventuelle Therapieanpassung.

- Individuelle Tagebuch-Einrichtung (z.B. Vorauswahl Symptome und Medikation)
- Tagebucheintrag zu mehreren Symptomen inkl. Situationsbeschreibung
- Anzeige der Eintr√§ge als Graph oder Kalenderansicht
- Vergleich einzelner oder mehrerer Symptome in ausgew√§hltem Zeitfenster
- Anleitung f√ºr effizientes Dokumentieren
- Individuell konfigurierbare Erinnerungsfunktion (z.B. f√ºr Tagebucheintrag) 

MS Tagebuch wurde von der unabh√§ngigen Patientenorganisation Deutsche Multiple Sklerose Gesellschaft, Bundesverband e. V. (DMSG) und seinem Landesverband in Baden-W√ºrttemberg, AMSEL, Aktion Multiple Sklerose Erkrankter e.V., mit finanzieller Unterst√ºtzung der Bank of America realisiert.

title: MS Trust Publications
description:
The MS Trust is a UK charity that believes nobody should have to manage multiple sclerosis alone. An MS diagnosis can be devastating, for people with MS and their loved ones. You may feel lost, alone and uncertain of the future. But you don‚Äôt have to deal with it alone. The MS Trust is here for everyone affected by MS, from the moment of diagnosis and throughout your journey. We‚Äôre here today, tomorrow and every day after, making sure a life with MS isn‚Äôt a life defined by MS.
 
The MS Trust prides itself on providing practical, evidence based information for people affected by MS and their families. 

Features:
- Access to free MS Trust information publications that cover everything from diagnosis and symptoms to talking with your family about MS. 

- Access to Open Door, the MS Trust's free, quarterly magazine for people with multiple sclerosis, their family and friends and supporters of the MS Trust. It is packed with practical tips, personal stories and the latest MS news and research.

title: myBETAapp‚Ñ¢
description:
Bayer‚Äôs myBETAapp‚Ñ¢ can help support your treatment experience.

myBETAapp‚Ñ¢ is designed to assist you with managing your injections.  It allows you to record your injection information manually or by connecting with the BETACONNECT‚Ñ¢ autoinjector.
The app can only be used by patients who are at least 18 years old and have been prescribed Bayer‚Äôs treatment for relapsing-remitting multiple sclerosis. 

Please use these URLs to access the Important Safety Information, Full Prescribing Information, BETACONNECT‚Ñ¢ Instructions For Use (IFU), and myBETAapp‚Ñ¢ Instructions For Use (IFU). 

‚Ä¢	Important Safety Information: www.betaseronISI.com
‚Ä¢	Prescribing Information: www.betaseronPI.com
‚Ä¢	BETACONNECT‚Ñ¢ IFU: www.betaconnectIFU.com
‚Ä¢	myBETAapp‚Ñ¢ IFU: www.myBETAappIFU.com

myBETAapp‚Ñ¢ includes the following features and functions:

1.	Displays scheduled injections according to the injection routine (i.e. one injection every other day).

2.	Displays recommended injection sites on the body, based on the recommended injection site rotation (injection sites are based on the standard rotation scheme). 

3.	Displays a monthly calendar of scheduled and recorded injections.

4.	Connects with the BETACONNECT‚Ñ¢ autoinjector via Bluetooth¬Æ technology to transfer injection data recorded with the BETACONNECT‚Ñ¢ autoinjector.

5.	Sends reminders to you*.

6.	Records indicators of health and wellness and summarizes the information in a chart. (This feature is not available in all countries.)

7.	Allows you to share your information‚Ä†, including details of your injections, with your BETA Nurse or healthcare team if you opt to do so. (This feature is not available in all countries.)

8.	Receives messages from your BETA Nurse. (This feature is not available in all countries.)

*The reminder is not synchronized with the reminder used in the BETACONNECT‚Ñ¢ autoinjector. You may get reminders from both your BETACONNECT‚Ñ¢ autoinjector and from myBETAapp‚Ñ¢ at different times. Make sure that you only take your medication as prescribed by your physician.

‚Ä†Healthcare professionals must have the BETACONNECT‚Ñ¢ Navigator software and configure it properly, and a patient must have sharing enabled in myBETAapp for HCPs to obtain this information.

Bayer values your comments, questions and concerns posted on the App Store. As responding within the App Store is limited, please contact us directly at 1-844-351-5696. Please note that we will not provide any information about products. In case of questions regarding our products, please contact your physician or pharmacist. If you are experiencing a medical emergency, contact your healthcare professional immediately.

myBETAapp‚Ñ¢ is not intended to offer or replace professional medical advice. If you have any questions regarding your RRMS treatment please contact your physician.

BAYER, the Bayer Cross, BETAPLUS and BETASERON are registered trademarks of Bayer. myBETAapp and BETACONNECT are trademarks of Bayer.

title: RealTalk MS
description:
This is the most convenient way to access the RealTalk MS podcast on your phone. With this app you are always connected to the latest episodes and the show.  You can also star your favorite episodes and save them to a list so you can easily enjoy them over and over! This app is complete access to RealTalk MS and if you're a fan of the show you won't want to be without it!
 
This app contains the following additional features:
 
* Streaming access to play episodes from anywhere
* Always updated with the latest episodes- and an archived back catalog
* Playback resume (when interrupted by a call or other distraction)
* Access to exclusive extras like PDFs, wallpapers, and bonus content
* Quick access to all the contact methods for the show like call, email, web, Facebook, and Twitter
 
Thank you for downloading this app and supporting the show!

Please note, not all episodes have exclusive extras.

title: IBD Healthline
description:
You‚Äôre not alone, even if IBD sometimes makes it feel this way. There‚Äôs a whole world of people with IBD just like you waiting to connect and lend support.

Whether you‚Äôre newly diagnosed or a seasoned vet, you can meet others who understand exactly what you‚Äôre going through because they‚Äôve been there too.

Our mission is to empower people to live beyond their disease through compassion, support, and knowledge. From one-on-one chats to group discussions, we make connecting easy. We are a safe place to find and receive advice, seek and offer support, and discover the latest news and research updates curated just for you.

HOW IT WORKS

Feed Your Soul 
Like all of your favorite social networks, we‚Äôve designed an activity feed to connect you with other members, just like you. We pride ourselves on making IBD Healthline a safe and secure space where you can join live discussions, connect one-to-one, and read the latest news and wellness articles about your condition.

Live Group Chats with IBD Community Leaders
Add your take to any conversation in one of our many groups! It‚Äôs a great way to swap stories and share what‚Äôs worked or not while meeting others in the community. Each weekday our IBD Healthline guide leads a live discussion in one of our groups:

Personal Community
Treatment and Side Effects
Newly Diagnosed
Diet & Alternative Therapies
Mental & Emotional Health
Navigating Healthcare
Work/School/Career
Inspiration
General


Meet Your Match
We connect you with a new member from our community each day at 12 p.m. PST. We recommend and introduce members to you based on your IBD type, treatment, and lifestyle interests and needs. Browse member profiles and request to match with anyone from our community. See members online now to instantly message.

Connect Anytime, Anywhere
You‚Äôll have easy access to all your messages in one place. See who‚Äôs online and send a message whenever you want to connect. Get notified when a member messages you.

Discover the World of IBD
Get handpicked wellness and news stories reviewed by Healthline‚Äôs team of medical professionals delivered to you each week. Stay informed about new treatments, what‚Äôs trending, and the latest in clinical trials. Find ways to nurture your body, mind, and spirit.



ABOUT HEALTHLINE

Healthline Media is the second-largest and fastest-growing consumer health publisher in the world, reaching 125 million people a month. Healthline‚Äôs mission is to be your most trusted ally in your pursuit of health and well-being.
You can depend on us to provide expert content along with genuine caring. We‚Äôll support, guide, and inspire you toward the best possible health outcomes for you and your family. Our solid profitability and rapid growth enables us to invest in expanding our reach and offerings to make even more of a difference for our users.

comments: I haven't been able to sign up since I downloaded this app. Why is this happening?

It is a great community of people from all over the world. Everyone is trying to help each other figure out different ways to get relief and work towards remission. Thank you for providing us with a way to connect and exchange ideas and advice! üíú

So the app logged me out for schedule maintenance one night, doesn't seem to recognize my log in info now as it keeps stating an error. Tried to reset the password but still fails. I've shared some private stuff on this app forum to just be kicked out like that. I hope anyone else thinking about using this app, be mindful of what you share because ultimately, they can close your account for doing nothing at all.
It is great app but recently I cant use the app because of it requires high speed connection even my connection speed is 1MB/S but it says check your connection.
This app is great in it's mission of fostering community among people with IBD. It is a great resource.

title: MS AYUSHPRANA
description:
Ayurveda treat the individual and then the disease.  For curing or controlling any disease with ayurveda, needs individual medicine ,individual diet and exercise. This app helps to find the individual constitution and finally leading to you to an individual diet and yoga. The principle of the food acting as a medicine is being realized here. About 500 food articles analyzed on the basics of ayurveda. The classical yoga postures are then selected according to the body element and body nature. We also have provided yoga based on different MS symptoms like vision, balancing etc. Possibility for online chat and fine tuning of your diet and exercise is possible. Moreover continuous addition of self treatment and other beneficial procedures and practices of MS will be added in future.
Expected additions in the next month : diet during relapse, possibility for online consultation for diet and yoga, how to improve sleep in MS,yoga  and diet for sexual part, seasonal changes in diet, how to avoid and manage common infection, do‚Äôs and don‚Äôts for ms, daily regimen for ms and many more.

title: MS 3Dme
description:
The video in this App was specifically created for people newly diagnosed with Multiple Sclerosis. The objective of the video is to help those diagnosed with MS, their family, friends, parents and teachers to understand this disease better. An improved understanding of this disease will hopefully alleviate some of the anxiety newly diagnosed people have about their diagnosis. This App also has a series of questions and answers and users are encouraged to share and tweet their results.

The central nervous system (CNS), which consists of the brain, spinal cord and optic nerves, is affected by Multiple Sclerosis. Using high definition 3D visualisation and multimedia we take a look inside the human body at the nerve cells in the CNS to explain the sclerosing or scarring of the myelin sheath covering the axon of the oligodendrocyte (nerve cell). This sclerosing causes the transmission of nerve impulses to be slowed or dissipated.

More products available on 3Dme Store http://store.3dme.com.au/
Stock Footage
Stock Images
Learning Clips
Learning Modules
Apps and iBooks

title: ECTRIMS
description:
This mobile app is provided by ECTRIMS, the European Committee for Treatment and Research in Multiple Sclerosis.
For a quarter of a century, ECTRIMS has served as Europe‚Äôs and the world‚Äôs largest professional organisation dedicated to the understanding and treatment of multiple sclerosis.
Access information all events, fellowships and news of the society.
The mobile app will include the ECTRIMS Congress 2018, 10 October ‚Äì 12 October 2018, Berlin, DE. Access all sessions, presentations, posters, abstracts, exhibitors & maps. Browse sessions by day, Topic, Types & Tracks.
Create your personalised Congress programme (synchronised with your online Scientific Programme & Planner). Vote & Ask questions during the ‚ÄúMobile app interactive sessions‚Äù track. Find practical Congress information.
Before first use, you'll need to download the latest conference data. Afterwards, you can use most of the app offline although updates will be available regularly before and during the Congress. ECTRIMS Mobile app is accessible to everyone interested in the field of MS.

title: MS Care Connect
description:
MS Care Connect was created by MS experts to help you confidentially monitor your health over time and share that information with your doctor, if you choose. Track and record every aspect of your MS health with easy-to-use features, see your results in real-time data visualizations, and compare your MS experience with other anonymous users.  With these insights, you can have more productive conversations with your healthcare team and make more informed decisions about your care.

‚Ä¢  Health Tracker: A convenient tool to monitor your daily MS symptoms and well-being
‚Ä¢  Performance Metrics: Fun, game-like exercises that measure your physical and mental functioning 
‚Ä¢  Surveys: Brief questionnaires created by researchers that provide information about your symptoms and treatments, and the impact of MS on your lifestyle

Also in the app:
‚Ä¢  Heat Alerts: Stay cool and receive notifications when the weather may increase the severity of your symptoms
‚Ä¢  Tips and Facts: Broaden your MS knowledge and get tips to help you meet your health goals

Once you start using the app, sign in to your personal dashboard at mscareconnect.com to see all of your data, and begin comparing it to others who use the app.

title: WebMD: Check Symptoms, Rx Savings, & Find Doctors
description:
** Coronavirus / COVID-19 Outbreak: Tap the card on our home screen for the latest updates on the 2020 coronavirus outbreak. **

From WebMD, the one healthcare app you need to check symptoms; learn about conditions and drugs; research treatments and diagnoses; find doctors and specialists in your area; get Rx discounts available at your local pharmacy; and set medication reminders. 

Key Features: 

‚Ä¢ Symptom Checker ‚Äì Choose your symptoms, learn about potential conditions or issues, and lookup treatment and care options.
‚Ä¢ Doctor Directory ‚Äì Find the closest doctors and specialists based on your current location or search by city, state or zip. 
‚Ä¢ WebMD Rx ‚Äì We partner with major pharmacy chains to find the lowest prescription drug prices, which often beat insurance co-pays. It‚Äôs 100% free to use. No registration required.
‚Ä¢ Medication Reminders ‚Äì Never miss a dose. You‚Äôll receive reminders when it‚Äôs time to take your medications. View daily prescription schedules and instructions, plus pill images with dosage and timing information for each drug. 
‚Ä¢ Conditions ‚Äì Find medically-reviewed information about conditions relevant to you and learn more about causes, treatments, and related symptoms. 
‚Ä¢ Customization and Saving Functionality ‚Äì Save your conditions, drugs, doctors, hospitals, pharmacies, and healthy living articles for secure, easy access and reference. 
‚Ä¢ Drug Interaction Checker ‚Äì Find and identify potentially harmful and unsafe combinations of prescription medications by entering two or more drugs in question.

ABOUT WebMD
WebMD Health Corp. (Nasdaq: WBMD) is the leading provider of health information services, serving consumers, physicians, healthcare professionals, employers, and health plans through our public and private online portals, mobile platforms and health-focused publications. More than 95 million unique visitors access the WebMD Health Network each month.

If you are a California resident, California law may provide you with certain rights regarding our use of your personal information. For more information relevant to our users who are California residents, please review the "California Residents" section of our Privacy Policy linked on this download page or within our app.

The WebMD Health Network includes WebMD Health, Medscape, MedicineNet, emedicineHealth, RxList, theheart.org, drugs.com and Medscape Education.
SOURCE WebMD Health Corp.

WebMD. Better Information. Better Health.
WebMD does not provide medical advice, diagnosis or treatment. Always seek the advice of your physician or other qualified health provider with any questions you may have regarding a medical condition. Never disregard professional medical advice or delay in seeking it because of something you have read on the WebMD mobile application.

recentChanges:
Introducing Profile.
All your saved health information is now stored in your profile.
- Save your doctors‚Äô contact information so it‚Äôs always on hand.
- Save Rx coupons for easy access at the pharmacy. Just show the Pharmacist the coupon on your phone, and save on prescriptions.
- All of your saved articles, drugs and conditions in one convenient place.
- See an overview of all your medication reminders.
comments: I have found that searching for certain terms, such as "dementia", will get no hits inside the app but will get plenty of hits on the WebMD website. I would say that about one-third of the time when I search for a condition or anasic keyword that obviously should get results, I get no results at all. So it would appear that the app does not have access to all of the content found on the Web MD website. To me, this means there is really no point in using the app.

A great resource for all things health and medical-related. I use the symptom checker feature the most, but the app also features articles on health conditions, information on different medications, and COVID articles. Definitely a great resource, and completely free!
This is such an app for info on medical anything. Including identifying pills that you find in your cabinet and can't remember or know what it is.

I've had and trusted the app for years, but about 2 months ago it suddenly started regularly spamming me with notifications with Corona news... Mostly scary and negative stories about people being reinfected, death and about immunization trials being cancelled by johnson and johnson due to safety concerns etc.... WHY ARE YOU SPAMMING ME WITH MORE FEAR MONGERING DON'T WE HAVE ENOUGH FEAR IN OUR LIVES!?!? I'm so furious. Sit on my phone and keep quiet until I need you. Notifications disabled
The drug interaction checker not working properly. Says it found 2 interactions but only describes 1.Shows it found 3 interactions but only describes 2...and so on.

title: MedNotesPlus
description:
The app tracks the Injection Sites.  It could be used by people on Copaxone, Avonex, Rebif or other injectable medications. This app could be beneficial to people with Multiple Sclerosis ( MS ) or with any other medical condition. You can enter a quick note associated with an injection, add an audio note, add a photo or just create a note to track your symptoms or any other medical events. 

Features include:
* No Ads
* Track injection sites
* Text Note/Journal entries
* Speech-to-text 
* Search option
* Photo notes
* Audio notes
* Export text Notes into a pipe delimited file.
* Email text Notes
* Reminders
* Backup DB
* Restore DB
* Restore DB from MedNotes or MedNotesTP
* Site of the shots show on the main screen for each of the notes

Touch the Menu key to add a note. The app will automatically save the notes and the injection site when you go back to the main screen.  If you need to make a note of an event that happened in the past, you can set a date, which would be a new date for the record.  If the date is not set manually, it would be set automatically as a current date on the Mobil device.

Some content is now available in Russian, French and German. Translated using Google Translate.
descriptionHTML:
The app tracks the Injection Sites. It could be used by people on Copaxone, Avonex, Rebif or other injectable medications. This app could be beneficial to people with Multiple Sclerosis ( MS ) or with any other medical condition. You can enter a quick note associated with an injection, add an audio note, add a photo or just create a note to track your symptoms or any other medical events.

Features include:
* No Ads
* Track injection sites
* Text Note/Journal entries
* Speech-to-text

Some content is now available in Russian, French and German. Translated using Google Translate.

comments: I've been using this app for several months now, and it makes my life so much easier. Being able to see the entire history of each injection site is so much more useful than using the copaxone journal. I email a copy of the database to myself weekly just in case something happens to my phone. THANK YOU DEV!!!
This app is very simple and helpful. I only give it four starts because I can't figure out where the "menu" bottom is to take a photo. My only complaint.
Works great for tracking my Rebif injections. My only suggestion is that you add buttocks sites.
The best and most stable.  Well worth the price.

It surprises me that the drug companies haven't done this already. But given that this is incredibly handy forkeeping track of injections. A bit buggy and the UI isn't beautiful but it does the trick. You can even export your injection notes to a text file for safe keeping
