summary: Kegel exercises for each day for women and men!
developerAddress: 203-119 Madison Ave S, Kitchener, ON N2G 3M4
comments: My true purpose for trying this app was to help with digestive issues I've experienced for the past two years. Figured, why not? This helps! Matter of fact, I would rate it top 3 of what is putting my system back on track. I've been using this app for about 8 months now and I absolutely love it. As of right now, at almost 50 and normal weight, my pelvic muscles are on point. ( Sorry if that sounds awkward.) This app keeps me focused and, oftentimes, I meditate through these exercises.

Simple, effective. This has 2 simple types of Kegel exercises, performed after each other. It builds repetition and time slowly each day. Perfect for post hysterectomy. It gives a discreet reminder on my phone. I have the app set to vibrate times during exercises so I can close my eyes and concentrate rather than counting or watching clock. I HIGHLY recommend.

I love this I have tried doing legal excercise on my own but would not feel like I was doing them correctly. This app shows me how to make progress. I have been doing this for about a week and can feel the muscles getting a little toner I guess you would say. I am not sure how to say it. I just feel it working

I like the exercises in this app for basic squeeze-release kegels, and that they slowly progress each day without you having to advanced them, much as a personal trainer would do. My only two gripes so far after using it for a few days, and why it fell short of five stars, are that I wish there was at count down before beginning the exercises like 3-2-1-go, and I wish you could set reminders to do the exercises multiple times a day.
Ads are not intrusive at all. Design of app good. Can do anywhere and noone knows what you're doing. The graph is encouraging to try and get yourself up the levels! Straightforward; thank you!

title: Ada ‚Äì your health companion
description:
Ada helps you and your loved ones check symptoms and discover what might be causing them ‚Äì day or night without an appointment. Whatever‚Äôs bothering you, from stomach problems to headache, Ada‚Äôs free symptom checker can help you find answers and let you know if you should see a doctor.

 Join the 10 million people who have already downloaded the world's most popular symptom check.‚Ä® Doctors trained Ada for years, so you can get a prediagnosis within minutes. 


How do free symptom checks work?

You answer simple questions about your own or someone else‚Äôs health and symptoms.
Ada‚Äôs AI assesses your answers against its medical dictionary of thousands of disorders and medical conditions.
You receive a personalized assessment report that tells you what could be wrong and what to do next.


What can you expect from an assessment?

- Data privacy and security ‚Äì we apply the strictest data regulations to protect you and keep your information private.
- Smart results ‚Äì our core system connects medical knowledge with intelligent technology.
- Personalized health information ‚Äì your guidance is personal to your unique health profile. 
- Assessments for loved ones ‚Äì if you assess someone else, their information stays separate from your own. 
- Health checks ‚Äì your assessments include information that may be relevant and helpful to your doctor. 
- 24/7 access ‚Äì you can use the free symptom checker anytime, anywhere.


What can you tell Ada?

Ada answers medical questions of every kind. Here are some of the most common searches:

Symptoms
- Fever
- Allergic rhinitis
- Loss of appetite
- Headache
- Abdominal pain and tenderness 
- Nausea
- Fatigue
- Vomiting
- Dizziness


Medical conditions:
- Common cold 
- Influenza infection (flu)
- Viral sinusitis
- Diabetes
- Tension headache
- Migraine
- Chronic pain
- Fibromyalgia
- Arthritis
- Allergy
- Irritable bowel syndrome (IBS)
- Anxiety disorder
- Depression

Categories:
- Skin conditions such as rashes, acne, insect bites
- Pregnancy 
- Children‚Äôs health
- Sleeping problems
- Indigestion issues, such as vomiting, diarrhea
- Eye infections

Disclaimer
The Ada Health App is a Class I medical device in the European Union. Registration in other markets is pending.

We want to hear from you. If you have any feedback or just want to get in touch, reach us at hello@ada.com

comments: Pretty accurate heading. Again HEADING and not a diagnostic So people won't get it wrong about the app. Extremelly helpful, since the test I've inputed on was an already medical confirmed diagnosis and ADA has provided three oprions which one of them is the one I am on current medical treatment. So, I will definitely use it as a pre-docs visit since it helps to describe symptoms to the physician. First use no ads so far, which is great. Lets see if it stays this way.

I absolutely adore this app, I don't see myself ever getting rid of it. If you're ever unsure of what you have or need a guideline for what you may have, it is the most perfect app. It doesn't make you panic, it explains everything and is so calming when you're worried for the worst. Thank you to the creators! I adore this app and I'm so thankful for it!

This is a really awesome app, I use it every time I feel unwell. And it saved me so many trips to the doctor. The UI looks modern, descriptions of either symptoms or diseases is accurate while also easy to understand. And the best thing? it doesn't have ads, some kind of overpriced subscription or anything like that. this one is my must have.

It is generally a good app, but I put my symptoms in and it focused more on my mild headache and other small things than the actual problem that caused me to try this in the first place which was more important than that head ache, it does this quite a lot but other than this, it's quite good! It is a good way to track symptoms and I haven't seen many ads but it does need to work on the symptom assessment a bit more, but that said, it is hard to make that perfect but it can help.

This app is extremely helpful, I've used it dozens of times since I downloaded. Love that it remembers details about people other than me. It would be cool to have the option to import my medical records .... Not sure if that is something that would be possible to do? Either way, I've love this app, and it never takes long before I feel the need to download it onto a new phone.

title: mySymptoms Food Diary & Symptom Tracker (Lite)
description:
Record, track, and analyze your food, mood, and symptoms to gain insights into your digestive health. 

mySymptoms makes logging a food and symptom diary easy - remembering your favorite foods and providing customizable symptoms. The diary analysis reveals any patterns that emerge between your diet and symptoms. Print a PDF (Android 4.4 or above) / web report of your diary/journal.


DIARY / JOURNAL

‚Ä¢ Record food, drink, medication, stress, exercise, environmental factors, and other activities and notes 
‚Ä¢ Record any symptoms you experience (including intensity, duration, and notes) 
‚Ä¢ Record your energy, sleep quality, and bowel movements (using Bristol scale)
‚Ä¢ View and modify your diary entries 
‚Ä¢ Create and modify your own symptoms 
‚Ä¢ Export your food diary as a PDF (Android 4.4 or above), CSV, or Web report for printing or sharing


INSIGHTS

‚Ä¢ Discover any patterns between your diet and symptoms
‚Ä¢ View suspect foods, trends, and correlations between food and symptoms
‚Ä¢ Configurable analysis


ORGANIZER 

‚Ä¢ Add or modify your own drinks, foods, medications, exercises, and other activities 
‚Ä¢ Add or modify meals with your own ingredients 
‚Ä¢ Add or modify detailed ingredients to any item ‚Äì food, drink or medication 


HOW TO USE

‚Ä¢ Simply begin by tracking your meals along with any symptoms you experience
‚Ä¢ Over time, the more you track, the more the analysis algorithms have to work with to provide any insights


mySymptoms is used by sufferers of:

‚Ä¢ IBS (Irritable Bowel Syndrome)
‚Ä¢ IBD (Inflammatory Bowel Disease)
‚Ä¢ Food intolerance and sensitivities such as dairy, gluten, lactose
‚Ä¢ Acid reflux
‚Ä¢ Crohn‚Äôs disease
‚Ä¢ Celiac disease
‚Ä¢ SIBO (Small Intestinal Bacterial Overgrowth)
‚Ä¢ Ulcerative colitis
‚Ä¢ Migraines & cluster headaches
‚Ä¢ Eczema
‚Ä¢ Bloating, heartburn, and many other digestive conditions 

mySymptoms is also useful for recording a FODMAP diet.


Please note that the analysis algorithms use statistical methods to identify suspect foods/items and do not understand your diet or specific health circumstances. 


The information provided by this app is not medical advice. Always consult a doctor if you have any concerns about your health. Always consult a licensed health professional prior to modifying your diet.


GO PREMIUM

‚Ä¢ Advanced analysis including ingredients and food groups (where provided)
‚Ä¢ Detailed results for each item includes more specific information, a histogram and trend chart 
‚Ä¢ Review events a food or symptom appears in
‚Ä¢ No adverts


mySymptoms also provides a list of common symptoms for food intolerance, IBS, IBD and Crohn's, but you can add extra symptoms as required.


Terms: http://mysymptoms.net/terms


NOTE: mySymptoms Food Diary currently supports portrait orientation only.


SUPPORT

If you experience any issues with mySymptoms, then please contact our support team - we will do our utmost to resolve the issue as soon as possible. Thanks!

support@skygazerlabs.com

MORE INFORMATION

Web: www.mysymptoms.net
Twitter: twitter.com/mysymptoms
Facebook: fb.me/mySymptoms
Enquiries: hello@mysymptoms.net

recentChanges: + Fix for file export on Android 10
comments: I just downloaded this app but I already love it! I love that it doesn't count calories and focuses on the way food makes you feel instead. I'm also loving every other category that you can track, like energy level, medication, environment, and mood. This is going to be so helpful with managing my chronic illness! Thank you to the developer! If I continue to use it I am for sure buying premium!

Paid premium, and didn't recieve. Sending questions and suggestions via email, and Facebook. No answer because they are closed on weekends. This is a useful app, for people suffering from gut issues caused by foods. They really need to add nutrition info to the diary because those with gastroparesis need to eat less fiber and not more. I have not found an app where the amount of fiber is customizable. And for this app, it would be appropriate.

Really good set up, easy to use. I like it a lot. I can log any food ingredients that I eat, the time and date, my mood at the time, and any symptoms I get, and much more. A very good diary to log my food and drink intake.

Once you've got your regular entries in its really quick to use. I like the range of options available. Mealtimes, exercise, mood, environment, sleep etc. Finding it really useful, plus I can send a report to my GP. üòä
This is the best app I could have found to help me focus on my eating and health. I like the flexibility of being able to write notes for entries and to add symptoms. I highly recommend to others.

title: Folia Health: Health & Symptom Tracker
description:
The most comprehensive health tracker app is now available on Android. Folia is an easy way to log and track your health. Thousands of people use Folia to track any combination of symptoms, conditions, or even undiagnosed symptoms.

Folia was built by a team of patients and caregivers to replace all your health notebooks, health journals, medication alarms and reminders, and symptom tracker apps so you can improve care for yourself and for people like you. 

With Folia you can:
‚òÖ Pick any combination of symptoms and treatments to track - you can track anything that has an impact on your health*
‚òÖ Record your observations in just 90 seconds a day using simple multiple choice questions*
‚òÖ Manage multiple patients if you are a caregiver, and collaborate with multiple caregivers*
‚òÖ Build graphs to understand health patterns and trends
‚òÖ Share your appointment guide with your clinicians
‚òÖ Contribute anonymized data to research - always with your permission
‚òÖ Earn cash cards for tracking
‚òÖ Feel safe and secure with our commitment to privacy and transparency 

*Our v1 Android app allows you to track scheduled questions, track one-off questions, and view your Folia Calendar and history on-the-go. Other features are accessible on our mobile-friendly website, but we will be building these into the Android app over the next few months!

What people are saying about Folia ‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è

‚ÄúIt takes only a few seconds a day, and yet my Folia data tells the whole story.‚Äù
- CF mom

‚ÄúThis has been THE best app for managing all of my symptoms. It's simple to use, and I can see what may be triggering extra fatigue or flares.
- autoimmune patient

‚ÄúIt‚Äôs so easy to integrate into my routine, and it‚Äôs particularly helpful at reminding me to take care of myself on days when routines fail.‚Äù
- patient 

‚ÄúThis app has helped me stay on track with all his medications by providing an organized list of the meds I give him by time of day. It‚Äôs so easy to reference, and I love that I can even track if I change or skip a medication dose for any reason. 

I‚Äôm able to run a summary report of the symptoms I track before clinic visits to help me summarize how my son truly is doing since the last visit. It helps me prepare for all the questions I get at clinic from providers and has alleviated my stress during those clinic visits because I‚Äôm prepared. 

Lastly, the Folia team is amazing and there to help you. They have made me custom reports to summarize my son‚Äôs symptoms in a better way for me.‚Äù
- CF mom

We have over a hundred conditions represented in the Folia community, and we work closely with the cystic fibrosis, primary immunodeficiency, and autoimmune (fibromyalgia, rheumatoid arthritis, crohn‚Äôs and colitis, multiple sclerosis) communities. If you don‚Äôt see your condition listed when you register, just message us and we‚Äôll add it! 


Read more about our commitment to privacy: https://www.foliahealth.com/privacy

Read our End User License Agreement: https://www.foliahealth.com/eula

Read our privacy policy: https://www.foliahealth.com/privacy-policy

comments: Folia Health is a great and easy was to track your medical needs. I honestly took a break from using Folia Health due to them not having an Andriod dedicated app. However, now that the Andirod app is here I love it. I enjoy being able to easily check off what medications and treatments I did that day, from the comfort of my bed at night. I also love how active and friendly the Folia Health team is!! Using Folia Health has made my health tracking easy and has provided me peace of mind!

Lacks a lot of features. If youre tracking any kind of health issues, you usually would want to track the time, symptom, intensity & location. This feels like a glorified notebook where you can only type in keywords for your symptoms too. So no full sentences. I have used health tracking apps that have way better features. There is no space for vital signs either. Just lacking a lot. Was so looking forward to the app but it didnt deliver.

title: BLADDERUNNER
description:
BladdeRunner is the winner project of The World VS MS (Multiple Sclerosis), an international contest, promoted by Sanofi Genzyme along with other partners such as Entrepreneurial Spark, MS Ireland and Wired.
The first edition of the contest (in 2016) challenged competitors to develop innovative projects addressing the main challenges of multiple sclerosis patients selected by the MS community itself.

The winning project, BladdeRunner aims to address the issue of bladder control through the development of a smartphone ‚Äòapp‚Äô that helps improve the quality of life of MS patients suffering from bladder control issues.

title: Neuro-Compass Toolbox
description:
This App has been developed for healthcare professionals who care for people with multiple sclerosis (MS). Two tools are currently available: the Treatment Monitoring Tool and MS Progression Discussion Tool.

Treatment Monitoring Tool 

‚Ä¢	Summarises the monitoring requirements recommended by the European Medicines Agency (EMA) for all disease modifying therapies (DMTs) approved for the treatment of people with MS in Europe.

‚Ä¢	The App enables the user to view the monitoring requirements for up to four DMTs at the same time. The monitoring requirements are separated out into monitoring requirements before starting a patient on treatment, monitoring during treatment initiation and while treatment is ongoing, and monitoring requirements after stopping treatment with each disease modifying therapy.

MS Progression Discussion Tool (MSProDiscuss)

‚Ä¢	The MS Progression Discussion Tool is a clinician-completed tool for use by healthcare professionals in clinical practice to educate and sensitize about the risk of progressing from RRMS to SPMS and facilitate physician-patient interaction. 

‚Ä¢	The tool uses information from patient symptoms and impacts experienced in the past 6 months to generate a traffic light system that complements physician discussion regarding patient progression to SPMS. It was developed based on qualitative research with clinicians and patients and empirical assessments of real-world evidence. It has been pilot-tested and validated with clinicians in the real world. 

Neuro-Compass is an essential medical education resource, developed by a steering group of experts in MS with a breadth of knowledge and experience in the field.
This educational resource has been developed independently with educational funding from founding supporter Biogen International GmbH and further support from Novartis International AG. All content in the App is provided for informational purposes only. Please refer to the full prescribing information for your country when prescribing any disease modifying therapies.

title: Pakistan MS Registry App
description:
Pakistan Multiple Sclerosis Registry is a national registry for patients with MS and demyelinating diseases.

This study will enroll patients with diagnosis of Multiple Sclerosis and other demyelinating diseases (optic neuritis, Neuromyelitis optica, ADEM, Transverse myelitis and other MS variants).

Purpose of this study is to identify types, MRI findings, presentation, care and outcome of these patients

Patients will be enrolled from more than 70 centers throughout country including AJ Kashmir. Target enrollment is 1000 per year over three years (2019-2022)

This study is supported by:
Multiple sclerosis education and research forum, Aga Khan University Genzyme has provides un restricted educational grant for this forum

Principal investigator:
Mohammad Wasay MD, FRCP, FAAN
Professor
Aga Khan University, Karachi
Mohammad.wasay@aku.edu

Study coordinator:
Khalidmir Khan
Khalidmir.khan@aku.edu

- New Factors Tracker: Record factors that affect your health, such as: Virus Risk Factors, Digestion, Social Time, Weather, Cravings, Ailments or add your own health factors with icons!
- New Integration: Support for Siri voice commands (for quicker check-ins and access to various screens)
- Additional Languages: Danish and Indonesian

comments: Works well as medication reminder! Using it to track my mood for CBT. I've upgraded to be able to share my treatment with my family and therapist.. Didn't see this functionality in other apps.
It is free to use so I like it <3 I use it to manage my health and wellness‚Ä¶ I was looking for the livongo app to track diabetes and set insulin reminders, but this one is good too.
App freezes every time I try to cancel subscription.

To me, the app was not user-friendly. I found myself entering the same information repeatedly and sometimes the data just would not save (specifically in the Goals section). Second, the format provides low visibility. I was looking for something thst displays data like a calendar with icons and notes to show my doctors an overall picture of my health for each day. This is more like a database that has to be searched by individual criteria. I can't use this app in its current format.
Simple and organized; has a user-friendly interface! A very helpful app!

title: mySymptoms Food Diary & Symptom Tracker
description:
Record, track, and analyze your food, mood, and symptoms to gain insights into your digestive health. 

mySymptoms makes logging a food and symptom diary easy - remembering your favorite foods and providing customizable symptoms. The diary analysis reveals any patterns that emerge between your diet and symptoms. Print a PDF (Android 4.4 or above) / web report of your diary/journal.


DIARY / JOURNAL

‚Ä¢ Record food, drink, medication, stress, exercise, environmental factors, and other activities and notes 
‚Ä¢ Record any symptoms you experience (including intensity, duration, and notes) 
‚Ä¢ Record your energy, sleep quality, and bowel movements (using Bristol scale)
‚Ä¢ View and modify your diary entries 
‚Ä¢ Create and modify your own symptoms 
‚Ä¢ Export your food diary as a PDF (Android 4.4 or above), CSV, or Web report for printing or sharing


INSIGHTS

‚Ä¢ Discover any patterns between your diet and symptoms
‚Ä¢ View suspect foods, trends, and correlations between food and symptoms
‚Ä¢ Configurable analysis
‚Ä¢ Detailed results for each item including histogram and trend chart 


ORGANIZER 

‚Ä¢ Add or modify your own drinks, foods, medications, exercises, and other activities 
‚Ä¢ Add or modify meals with your own ingredients 
‚Ä¢ Add or modify detailed ingredients to any item ‚Äì food, drink or medication 


HOW TO USE

‚Ä¢ Simply begin by tracking your meals along with any symptoms you experience
‚Ä¢ Over time, the more you track, the more the analysis algorithms have to work with to provide any insights


mySymptoms is used by sufferers of:

‚Ä¢ IBS (Irritable Bowel Syndrome)
‚Ä¢ IBD (Inflammatory Bowel Disease)
‚Ä¢ Food intolerance and sensitivities such as dairy, gluten, lactose
‚Ä¢ Acid reflux
‚Ä¢ Crohn‚Äôs disease
‚Ä¢ Celiac disease
‚Ä¢ SIBO (Small Intestinal Bacterial Overgrowth)
‚Ä¢ Ulcerative colitis
‚Ä¢ Migraines & cluster headaches
‚Ä¢ Eczema
‚Ä¢ Bloating, heartburn, and many other digestive conditions 

mySymptoms is also useful for recording a FODMAP diet.


Please note that the analysis algorithms use statistical methods to identify suspect foods/items and do not understand your diet or specific health circumstances. 


The information provided by this app is not medical advice. Always consult a doctor if you have any concerns about your health. Always consult a licensed health professional prior to modifying your diet.


mySymptoms also provides a list of common symptoms for food intolerance, IBS, IBD and Crohn's, but you can add extra symptoms as required.


Terms: http://mysymptoms.net/terms


NOTE: mySymptoms Food Diary currently supports portrait orientation only.


SUPPORT

If you experience any issues with mySymptoms, then please contact our support team - we will do our utmost to resolve the issue as soon as possible. Thanks!

support@skygazerlabs.com

MORE INFORMATION

Web: www.mysymptoms.net
Twitter: twitter.com/mysymptoms
Facebook: fb.me/mySymptoms
Enquiries: hello@mysymptoms.net

comments: I think this is a very well designed app and very user friendly. I love the fact that I can email her a full report of my days, from supplements to medications to exercise to reactions but some times I have questions and symptoms unrelated to any of the categories and a notes category would make it 5 stars plus! EDIT: Please stop asking me to leave a review when I've already done so! So annoying grrrrr ...
Great app for logging food, symptoms and sleep. Best I've found, easy and intuitive to use. Excellent support from the developer. Would recommend.
Very easy to use, well designed app
Works great for my celiac needs to log food entry and bowel movements but wish it would allow blood sugar results too. It's hard to find an app that does both.

Good app for entering your data (what you eat, how much and when), but the Analysis algorithm needs some work!! Not easy to comprehend, and I dont think I have problems with sweet potatoes, despite what it says.

title: Neurology pocket
description:
The Neurology app contains a collection of valuable and clinically relevant information on the important subject areas of neurology, simplifying the diagnostic and treatment paradigm. Includes recent updates, important guidelines, algorithms, well-illustrated images, scales, and scores which act as clinical reference guide for students, neurologists and other healthcare professionals when dealing with neurological conditions.

This neurological reference guide contains :
¬∑	Interactive Tools
¬∑	Lab Values
¬∑	Emergencies
¬∑	History and Presentation
¬∑	Clinical Anatomy
¬∑	Multiple Sclerosis
¬∑	Drugs
¬∑	DDX ‚Äì Differential Diagnosis
¬∑	H & P ‚Äì History and Presentation
¬∑	Clinical Anatomy
¬∑	Cerebro vascular Disease
¬∑	Infectious Diseases
¬∑	Dementia
¬∑	Movement Disorders
¬∑	Epileptic Seizures
¬∑	Neuromuscular / Neuropathic Disorders
¬∑	Neuro-oncology
¬∑	Traumatic Injury
¬∑	Pain Syndromes

Functionality of the app:

          - Get to the right entry directly and quickly with the index-search function
          - No more time consuming searching or browsing
¬∑	Bookmark function
¬∑	Notes function
¬∑	History function

title: MSFocus Radio
description: MS Focus Radio provides round-the-clock motivation, education, and empowerment to people affected by multiple sclerosis. Featuring original content produced by MS Foucs: The Multiple Sclerosis Foundation, as well as the best in audio books and inspirational music, MS Focus Radio is the MS resource that can travel with you throughout your day. You can listen on the web as well as on your Android and iOS devices. The mission of MS Focus Radio is to empower those affected by MS with the information necessary to make the most complete and educated decisions concerning their health. We do not advocate nor endorse any specific treatments, healing modalities, or practitioners. The material presented is for informational purposes only ‚Äì for specific advice, consult a healthcare professional. MS Focus Radio is a service of MS Focus: The Multiple Sclerosis Foundation. MS Focus Radio and MS Focus strive to provide objective, unbiased information. Though MSFocusRadio.org does accept advertising and sponsorship in order to provide year-round, 24/7 service, the production and/or selection of content is completely at the discretion of The Foundation.

title: MSVR
description:
Biogen continues its commitment through ongoing research, support, and services to help meet unmet needs in patients with Multiple Sclerosis (MS).  

Through virtual reality, Biogen puts you in the same room with three hypothetical patients who share the human experience of those who are impacted by MS.
These three patient perspectives are told in a 180-degree video experience viewed using Google Cardboard v2.
All patients in the following videos are portrayed by paid actors.‚Äù

title: PainScale - Free Chronic Pain Tracker Diary
description:
The Popular pain tracking app for iOS and Android !.  Awarded one of the Best Fibromyalgia apps of 2019 ‚Äì by Healthline. Join over 100,000 chronic pain patients who manage and scale their pain and symptoms with Painscale; the highly-ranked pain tracker health app on the web! 

The PainScale app offers a FREE suite of pain management tools to help chronic pain patients to scale their pain.
Manage a Pain Tracker Diary!

Created with input from doctors and chronic pain patients, the Pain Diary acts as a pain tracker and organizes all the information the patient needs in one accessible location. With over 800 organized articles, health tips, exercises, information on pain meditation programs and treatment options, pain management becomes easier.   	

PainScale provides personalized pain management education for users. Trusted content. is available to help people understand their symptoms and better manage their condition. By providing insights to a community of other patients who share their treatment information, PainScale helps patients discover information about treatment options that may work for their condition.
PainScale is an easy and simple to use, pain and health tracker app.
 
Features

 ‚Ä¢ Pain Diary ‚Äì log and track your pain to track triggers, pain intensity, symptoms, treatments, medications, activity, mood, and sleep digital scale.
 ‚Ä¢ Pain Reports ‚Äì get and send summary and detailed reports for better patient-physician communication, you can take all the information you need from the Pain Diary.
 ‚Ä¢ Insights - personal tips to help you discover information about treatment options to better manage your condition
‚Ä¢ Trusted Content ‚Äì get FREE access to a searchable library of articles, videos, and meditations to help find pain relief,
 ‚Ä¢ Daily Health Tips ‚Äì get daily meditation, stretches, and exercise routines, everything you need to help you cope with your chronic pain
 ‚Ä¢ Integration with Google Fit ‚Äì simplified and seamless connectivity with Google Fit for tracking health and fitness activity
 ‚Ä¢ Reminders ‚Äì get reminders to help stay engaged with restoring your health
 ‚Ä¢ Care Team Communication - tap-to-call and tap-to message functionality options that connects you directly with your Physician and Support Network
 ‚Ä¢ Customize your experience for pain management with a personal profile
Get the info you need in the following topics:

 ‚Ä¢ Chronic pain
 ‚Ä¢ Pain relief
 ‚Ä¢ Lower back pain
 ‚Ä¢ Back pain
 ‚Ä¢ Neck pain
 ‚Ä¢ A migraine
 ‚Ä¢ Fibromyalgia
 ‚Ä¢ Failed back surgery
 ‚Ä¢ CRPS
 ‚Ä¢ Arthritis
 ‚Ä¢ Pain management
 ‚Ä¢ Coping
 ‚Ä¢ Neuropathy
 ‚Ä¢ Nerve pain

Get Help: contact us at help@painscale.com
Visit Us: Access your account on the web.

Log in at https://www.painscale.com
Like Us: Join the PainScale community by liking us on Facebook https://www.facebook.com/MyPainScale/
 

What are the things that make your pain increase, what spikes or triggers it, and what helps you the most?
PainScale helps you get actionable insights to better your pain relief and health in general. 

Pain scale and pain diary have been used by physicians for almost five decades ‚Äì it is one of the most valuable tools in pain management. Painscale.com takes advantage of the modern digital technologies to provide an easy to use pain tracking solution using the same proven pain management methods. PainScale.com web site and the app is designed for educational purposes only. If you have any concerns about your own health or the health of someone else, you should always consult with a physician or other healthcare professional

Download Now PainScale - Free Chronic Pain Tracker Diary!!!

recentChanges: Added new personal insights for Triggers and Symptoms and bug fixes
comments: Outstanding App to help you track pain types, areas and symptoms. Able to show different pain types in different areas of the body. I love that you can add notes as well in journal entries! The reports are fantastic and easy to email with you deciding the custom time span. The insights that can show correlation between activity, weather, and other triggers really helps. Love that I can attach to Samsung Health and thus my sleep, EKGs and pulse rate, BP, etc to see correlations! Great App!!!

I've been using this app for months now and I still love it. It's easy to use, it syncs with my Samsung Health, and the helpful articles and tips are normally quick reads and informative, and it has easy adjustments in the settings. I highly recommend this app.

So far it's a good useful app. One suggestion. Love to have ability to add multiple entries during the day without altering my earlier input.This will help me better track triggers and effectiveness of the different things I do to help alleviate my pain. Also, there needs to be room for more than one entry for doc location,insurance& pain on opposite side of the body.If I have pain in back of legs and knees, the figure turns around but deleted the previous tagged body pain location.

I've only been using this app for a short time but so far it is the best that I have tried. I have chronic pain with various etiologies and the app has a detailed pain map that allows me to more precisely record my pain. The automatic time stamp is a great feature as is the ability to link it to my Fitbit for superior insights that corralate sleep and activity to pain levels. Im holding off on that 5th star because I am still learning the app and all of its functionality.

The PainScale app has been great! I am able to track my whole day. Pain, food and anything else I need. I have added my glucose readings in the notes. I am also able to put on there my activities making me able to see any issues and also my progress. Thank you!

title: VisualDx
description:
VisualDx is the single source for diagnostic clinical decision support. Searchable by symptoms, signs, and patient factors, VisualDx is the fastest path to a customized differential diagnosis. Tens of thousands of images and graphics speed comparison, recognition, and diagnosis. VisualDx is used to validate a diagnosis, access next steps for management and care, and for patient education. The VisualDx decision support and reference tool for physicians includes more than 3000 diagnoses and over 41 000 medical images. REQUIRES a VisualDx subscription; see below for details.

VisualDx combines expert medical knowledge, standardized terminology, intelligent search, and the best medical images to deliver concise and accurate answers. Search by diagnosis, build a patient-specific differential, or look up drug-induced adverse reactions by medication ‚Äì all at the point of care. VisualDx Mobile is the ONLY professional medical app to show disease variation with images. 

With VisualDx you can:

‚Ä¢        Quickly search by diagnosis for next steps on management and patient care.

‚Ä¢        Visually confirm a diagnosis by comparing medical images to your patient‚Äôs presentation.

‚Ä¢        Review diagnostic pearls and best tests at the point of care to aid with diagnosis.

‚Ä¢        Build a custom differential based on your patient‚Äôs signs, symptoms, and other key findings such as travel history.

‚Ä¢        View over 43,000 drug reactions

‚Ä¢        Provide on-the-spot patient education with real medical images.

‚Ä¢        Access ICD-10 and SNOMED CT codes.

‚Ä¢        Perform VisualDx Quiz to test your knowledge of visual presentations of disease, and compete against colleagues via leaderboards.

Over 1700 hospitals, clinics, and medical schools use VisualDx to aid diagnostic accuracy, enhance medical education, and improve patient outcomes.

INSTITUTIONAL SUBSCRIBERS
Launch VisualDx on a computer AT YOUR INSTITUTION and click the ‚ÄúVisualDx Mobile‚Äù link to register for a personal VisualDx user name and password to use on your mobile device.

INDIVIDUAL SUBSCRIBERS
CURRENT subscribers: use your existing user name and password with VisualDx Mobile.
NEW subscribers: sign up in the app to start using your VisualDx free trial.

Outstanding app. One day, it will becoms the basic tool for any physician in practice. I am so happy to have found out this app. Definitely worth the money.

Not useful in neurological disorders... MRI finding not included in the list menu ... poor identification of neurological sign and symptom ... my money is lost on this app üëøüò• I hope the administrator of this app to return my money
couldn't use it... because access must be through work or paid for? either way, I wasnt able to use it while seeing patients.

title: RA Healthline
description:
You‚Äôre not alone, even if living with rheumatoid arthritis sometimes makes it seem that way. There‚Äôs a whole world of people living with rheumatoid arthritis just like you, waiting to connect and lend support.

Whether you‚Äôre newly diagnosed or a seasoned vet, you can meet others who understand exactly what you‚Äôre going through because they‚Äôve been there too.

Our mission is to empower people to live beyond their condition through compassion, support, and knowledge. From one-to-one chats to group discussions, we make connecting easy. This is a safe place to find and receive advice, to seek and offer support, and to discover the latest news and research updates curated, just for you.

HOW IT WORKS

Feed Your Soul 
Like all of your favorite social networks, we‚Äôve designed an activity feed to connect you with other members, like you, living with rheumatoid arthritis. We pride ourselves on making RA Healthline a safe and secure space where you can join live discussions, connect one-to-one, and read the latest news and wellness articles about your condition.

Live Discussions with RA Community Leaders
Gain advice and share whatever is on your mind in any one of our groups. It‚Äôs a great way to swap stories, ask questions, and share ideas while meeting others in the community. Five nights a week, join our RA Healthline guide and experts in the community as they lead live discussions in one of these groups:
General
Pain Management
Medication and Treatments
Flares and Remission
Alternative Therapies
Escape From RA
Lifestyle
Mental and Emotional Health
Navigating Healthcare
Daily Life
Relationships
Work
Diagnosis
Symptoms
Complications


Meet Your Match
Let us connect you with a new member from our community every day. We‚Äôll recommend members to you based on your treatment plan, lifestyle interests, and needs. Browse member profiles and request to connect with anyone from our community, even instantly, with members listed as ‚ÄúOnline now.‚Äù

Connect Anytime, Anywhere
Access support with ease from your Members screen. Check and send messages, see who‚Äôs online, and get notified when a new message comes in, all so you‚Äôll never miss a thing.

Discover the World of Rheumatoid Arthritis
Get handpicked wellness and news stories reviewed by Healthline‚Äôs team of medical professionals delivered to you each week. Stay informed about new treatments, what‚Äôs trending, and the latest in clinical trials. Find ways to nurture your body, mind, and spirit for a new kind of support.


ABOUT HEALTHLINE

Healthline Media is the top ranked health publisher and number 44 on Comscore‚Äôs Top 100 Property rankings. Across all of its properties, Healthline Media publishes each month up to 1,000 scientifically accurate yet reader-friendly articles authored by more than 120 writers and reviewed by more than 100 doctors, clinicians, nutritionists, and other experts. The company‚Äôs repository contains more than 70,000 articles, each updated with current protocol.

More than 200 million people worldwide and 86 million people in the U.S. visit Healthline‚Äôs sites each month, according to Google Analytics and Comscore, respectively.

title: Amyloidosis Clinical Resources
description:
Amyloidosis Diagnosis and Treatment App for healthcare professionals 

A rare and challenging set of diseases including light chain (AL ‚Äì kappa / lambda), transthyretin (hereditary, ATTR), secondary (AA) and wild-type (formerly called senile systemic), this app provides clinically relevant information that offers healthcare professionals a brief yet practical disease overview and interactive tools which can lead to earlier diagnosis and therapeutic intervention. 

The content has been developed by Borm Bruckmeier Publishing in collaboration with the Amyloidosis Research Consortium and is intended for practicing physicians, resident physicians and other healthcare professionals involved in the diagnosis and treatment of patients with amyloidosis.
 
Highlights include:
 
‚Ä¢ Descriptions of the most frequently seen types of amyloidosis 
‚Ä¢ Clinical presentations 
‚Ä¢ Signs and symptoms characteristic of amyloidosis 
‚Ä¢ Differential diagnoses 
‚Ä¢ Elements of the diagnostic workup including laboratory tests, biopsies, and genetic testing 
‚Ä¢ Treatment strategies including stem cell transplant, disease-modifying medications, clinical trials and novel agents 
‚Ä¢ Core treatment centers 
‚Ä¢ Clinical trials 
‚Ä¢ Comprehensive resources to share with patients including: 
    o	Informative foundations and websites 
    o	Support groups (USA and international) 
    o	Treatment centers (USA and international) 
    o	Educational webinars, disease pamphlets and guides 
    o	Financial assistance for drugs and travel for treatment 
    o	Caregiver resources

title: LSVT Global LOUD
description:
LSVT Global provides innovative therapy solutions for Parkinson disease and other neurological conditions including stroke, multiple sclerosis and cerebral palsy. These evidence-based techniques also promote and support healthy aging.

Patients will use this app to:

- understand how to improve speech, voice and communication through training/treating healthy vocal loudness
- visualize the relationship between their effort and the increase in healthy vocal loundness they could achieve through training/treatment
- recognize the misperception individuals with Parkinson disease have about their relative vocal loudness

LSVT LOUD Certified Clinicians will use this app to:

- access detailed breakdowns of LSVT LOUD training or treatment session activities and skills checklists
- create digital homework logs to track patient/client progress throughout LSVT LOUD therapy/treatment sessions
- access additional educational resources and reimbursement codes

LSVT Global, Inc. pioneered the Lee Silverman Voice Treatments (LSVT LOUD¬Æ and LSVT BIG¬Æ ), innovative and clinically-proven methods for improving communication and movement in individuals with Parkinson disease with application to other neurological conditions and healthy aging.
This app is not a replacement for speech therapy/treatment from a certified LSVT LOUD professional speech clinician.

title: Rephysio - Rehabilitation and Physiotherapy
description:
Meet Rephysio, an amazing app used to perform rehabilitation at home or in dedicated places.  A modern rehabilitation solution on your smartphone! The app contains over 1000 exercises prepared by highly qualified physiotherapists, thanks to which each set of exercises is carefully prepared for both beginners and advanced. Rephysio will guide you through all the exercises with detailed video instructions on how to perform them.

The best features of the app:

‚Ä¢ Over 1000 dedicated exercises
‚Ä¢ 14 rehabilitation categories
‚Ä¢ Individual consultations and therapies
‚Ä¢ Tailored exercise schedule
‚Ä¢ Tracking exercise status
‚Ä¢ Levels of session advancement
‚Ä¢ Video instruction for each exercise
‚Ä¢ Detailed information about exercises
‚Ä¢ Tips for treating the condition
‚Ä¢ Multilingual
‚Ä¢ Dark theme

In addition to the basic categories - in the app you can also order a special dedicated individual plan created only for the person ordering. Ordering such a plan gives us the opportunity to consult in the form of a live chat with a physiotherapist - who, based on our guidelines, diseases and recommendations, will create for you a consultation or a dedicated exercise plan.

Basic categories of rehabilitation:

‚Ä¢ Obesity
‚Ä¢ Lumbar spine
‚Ä¢ Neck spine
‚Ä¢ Round back
‚Ä¢ Flat backs
‚Ä¢ Senior's zone
‚Ä¢ Upper limbs
‚Ä¢ Lower limbs
‚Ä¢ Parkinson's disease
‚Ä¢ Dysartria
‚Ä¢ Aphasia
‚Ä¢ Stroke
‚Ä¢ Multiple sclerosis
‚Ä¢ Facial nerve palsy

All categories are divided into sets and then into sessions. Each session has a specific level of exercise, according to a specially prepared rehabilitation program. If any set or session is a problem, you should consult the exercises with your physiotherapists.

The app tracks the progress of rehabilitation and automatically saves the last state of the exercise so that the next time you start the app, you can easily go to the last saved exercise. Thanks to this, you don't have to worry about accidentally closing the app or unloading your device.

Each exercise contains a detailed description of how to perform them, the number of repetitions and series, as well as the necessary information about the best place to perform and the necessary equipment, such as a skipping rope or exercise mat.

Rephysio has several languages, which is why the app adapts to the patient. A reminder of a session or exercise on different days of the week will allow you to tailor the app to your individual exercise preferences.

Not everyone likes the bright theme of the app, so we have introduced an amazing black theme, thanks to which we save battery and eyesight.



Terms and Conditions:
https://re-physio.com/terms-and-conditions

Privacy Policy:
https://re-physio.com/privacy-policy


--------------------------------------

Medical Disclaimer


Please seek a doctor's advice in addition to using this app, and before making any medical decisions.


The advice given by this app does not replace the opinion of a medical professional and need to seek the advice of a physiotherapist or doctor in addition to using the app before making any final decisions. If in any doubt, please consult a physiotherapist or doctor in addition to using this app, and before making any medical decisions.

title: CURRENT Medical Diagnosis and Treatment
description:
60th anniversary edition of the most popular, relied-upon guide to internal medicine. Single source reference that has authoritative, evidence-based coverage of more than 1,000 diseases and disorders including concise, yet thorough synopsis of diagnosis and treatment. Written by clinicians renowned in their respective fields, this trusted classic offers expert advice on all aspects of outpatient and inpatient medical care.

DESCRIPTION
For 60 years, CURRENT Medical Diagnosis and Treatment‚Äîthe flagship volume of the renowned Lange medical series‚Äîhas been delivering the authoritative information students, residents, and clinicians need to build their medical knowledge, expertise, and confidence. Covering the latest clinical developments in all facets of medicine and fully focused on bedside clinical issues, this new edition provides completely the latest guidelines, reference, drug prices, approved drugs, and evidence-based coverage of more than 1,000 diseases and disorders‚Äîall formatted to enable you to find the answers you need quickly and effortlessly.

This landmark guide covers inpatient and outpatient care, focusing on the diagnostic tools relevant to daily practice, and reviews all primary care topics, including gynecology/obstetrics, dermatology, ophthalmology, geriatrics, preventive medicine, psychiatry, and neurology. Now includes a ‚Äúyear in review‚Äù feature highlighting what‚Äôs new in CMDT!

KEY FEATURES

- Includes essentials of diagnosis for most diseases/disorders
- Hundreds of quick-access drug treatment tables with indexed trade names
- Diagnostic and treatment algorithms present important information in an at-a-glance style
- Up-to-date references provide peer-reviewed, evidence-based information
- Many full-color photographs, tables, figures and other illustrations
- Specific information regarding disease prevention and prognosis
- Medication treatment tables, with indexed trade names and updated prices

- Many full-color photographs, tables, figures and other illustrations
- Specific information regarding disease prevention and prognosis
- Medication treatment tables, with indexed trade names and updated prices

title: COPACTIV
description: "COPACTIV" este un asistent personal discret pe durata tratamentului pentru scleroza multipla. Aplicatia va va invata si va va ajuta sa administrati injectiile. Aceasta va fi asistentul dvs. personal, care va aminteste cand trebuie sa va administrati medicamentul si va va recomanda cel mai adecvat loc de pe corpul dvs. pentru administrare, astfel incat sa va simtiti bine. Aplicatia va va ajuta sa tineti un jurnal de administrare. Cu ajutorul acestei aplicatii veti primi si cele mai importante informatii despre tratamentul pentru scleroza multipla.

title: Peak ‚Äì Brain Games & Training
description:
Peak is the fun, free brain training workout designed around you. Peak uses brain games and puzzles to challenge memory, language and critical thinking to keep your mind active. 

With brain games made in partnership with academics from leading universities like Cambridge and NYU, and more than 12m downloads, Peak is a fun, challenging brain training experience.

It takes just 10 minutes a day to complete a brain training workout. And, with 45 brain games for adults, and new brain training workouts every day, there is always a fun challenge waiting for you.


KEY FEATURES
 
- Free brain games to challenge your Memory, Attention, Math, Problem Solving, Mental Agility, Language, Coordination, Creativity and Emotion Control.
- Learn which categories your brain excels in, and compete with friends by comparing your brainmap and brain game performance.
- Coach, the personal trainer for your brain, helps you track your progress and improve.
- Cognitive brain training with games from expert researchers at Cambridge University, NYU and more.
- Works offline so you can enjoy Peak brain games wherever you are.
- Selected by Google as Editor's Choice.
- More than 45 brain games available and regular updates to keep you challenged. 
- Get personalised brain training workouts and in-depth insights with Peak Pro.
- Get access to Peak Advanced Training modules: intensive programs that train a specific skill, including the new Wizard memory game created with Professor Barbara Sahakian and Tom Piercy in the Department of Psychiatry at the University of Cambridge.
 

IN THE NEWS

‚ÄúIts mini games focus on memory and attention, with strong detail in its feedback on your performance.‚Äù - The Guardian

‚ÄúImpressed with graphs in Peak that let you see your performance over time.‚Äù - The Wall Street Journal

‚ÄúThe Peak app is designed to provide each user with a profound level of insight into their current state of cognitive function.‚Äù - Techworld


DEVELOPED BY NEUROSCIENTISTS
 
Designed in collaboration with experts in neuroscience, cognitive science and education, Peak makes brain training fun and rewarding. Peak's scientific advisory board includes Professor Barbara Sahakian FMedSci DSc, Professor of Clinical Neuropsychology at the University of Cambridge.
 
Follow us - twitter.com/peaklabs
Like us - facebook.com/peaklabs
Visit us - peak.net
Say hi - hello@peak.net
 

For more information:
 
Terms of Use - http://www.peak.net/terms-and-conditions
Privacy Policy - http://www.peak.net/privacy-policy
Payment Policy - http://www.peak.net/payment-policy

recentChanges: Your brain is unique and that‚Äôs why Coach creates personal workouts just for you. But we all have specific skills we want to challenge and so we‚Äôre introducing Workout Selection. You can select from a range of workouts, each one specially created for you. Interested in language? Try our language workout! Only have 5 minutes to train? Our 5 minute Coffee Break workout is perfect!
comments: It's a solid app with a lot of challenges. Some of them pretty simple and common, other instead are very difficult, I love this balance. I used to play Elevate last year and I decided to change for something different, however there are few games (especially math ones) that I wish to have here as well! Hoping to see some new game in the future (:

The games on here are very good and I enjoyed playing them. Whether they actually do anything for your brain or whether you simply get better at playing them is an interesting and ongoing question! My only criticism is that the language is very american-based and so can be quite challenging if you are UK English speaking because you don't understand what object you should be looking for for example in the find the object game. Overall excellent.

First few weeks things were good, . Now my R√†ting has gone from 4 to 2. I have free version and am supposed to watch videos. Yeh, right! I push play and screens says "loading video" but it Never does. After 30 sec, I get bumped back to play screen, very boring ! If I was not a bed ridden senior citizen w/covid complications, it would not bother me so badly. I rebooted my ph & reinstalled your app too many, times~NO change. I enjoyed what little I saw of Peak. Hasta la vista !

I like the app. It brings me a lot of mental challenges, that are quite interesting. It really increases our IQ. The only problem I am facing is performance. Whenever a game starts or even in the middle of the same, it stutters and freezes, randomly. It doesn't occur often, but it disturbs, especially on timing challenges. OTT, the app is look good üôÇüëçüèª

Honestly, I never leave reviews, but I really do love this app! I paid for all the content and most of the time when I buy in app purchases for more content, I am left pretty bored and dissatisfied, but Peak is the only app so far that hasn't left me feeling like that! So thank you, and I really enjoy training daily to get me into the zone for using my mind for the rest of the day, as well as being able to see the progress I am making compared to other people within my age group.

title: T2D Healthline
description:
You‚Äôre not alone, even if living with type 2 diabetes sometimes makes it feel this way. There‚Äôs a whole world of people living with type 2 diabetes just like you, waiting to connect and lend support.

Whether you‚Äôre newly diagnosed or a seasoned vet, you can meet others who understand exactly what you‚Äôre going through because they‚Äôve been there too.

Our mission is to empower people to live beyond their condition through compassion, support, and knowledge. From one-to-one chats to group discussions, we make connecting easy. We are a safe place to find and receive advice, seek and offer support, and to discover the latest news and research updates curated, just for you.

HOW IT WORKS

Feed Your Soul
 
Like all of your favorite social networks, we‚Äôve designed an activity feed to connect you with other members, like you, living with type 2 diabetes. We pride ourselves on making T2D Healthline a safe and secure space where you can join live discussions, connect one-to-one, and read the latest news and wellness articles about your condition.

Live Group Chats with T2D Community Leaders

Share what‚Äôs on your mind in any one of our wide range of groups! It‚Äôs a great way to swap stories, ask questions, and share ideas while meeting others in the community. Each weekday, join our T2D Healthline guide in a live discussion in one of our groups:
- Diet and Nutrition
- Exercise and Fitness
- Healthcare
- Medications and Treatments
- Newly Diagnosed
- Complications
- Relationships
- Daily life 
- Travel
- Mental health
- Tests and monitoring
- Men‚Äôs Topics
- Women‚Äôs Topics


Meet Your Match

Let us connect you with a new member from our community each day at 12pm PST. We‚Äôll recommend members to you based on your treatment plan, lifestyle interests, and needs. Browse member profiles and request to connect with anyone from our community, even instantly with members listed as ‚ÄúOnline now.‚Äù

Connect Anytime, Anywhere

Access support with ease from your Members screen. Check and send messages, see who‚Äôs online, and get notified when a new message comes in, all so you‚Äôll never miss a thing.


Discover the World of Type 2 Diabetes

Get handpicked wellness and news stories reviewed by Healthline‚Äôs team of medical professionals delivered to you each week. Stay informed about new treatments, what‚Äôs trending, and the latest in clinical trials. Find ways to nurture your body, mind, and spirit for a new kind of support.



ABOUT HEALTHLINE

Healthline Media is the top ranked health publisher and number 36 on Comscore‚Äôs Top 100 Property rankings. Across all of its properties, Healthline Media publishes each month up to 1,000 scientifically accurate yet reader-friendly articles authored by more than 120 writers and reviewed by more than 100 doctors, clinicians, nutritionists, and other experts. The company‚Äôs repository contains more than 70,000 articles, each updated with current protocol.

More than 200 million people worldwide and 86 million people in the U.S. visit Healthline‚Äôs sites each month, according to Google Analytics and Comscore, respectively.

title: Vertigo Disease
description: Vertigo is a medical condition where a person feels as if they or the objects around them are moving when they are not. Often it feels like a spinning or swaying movement. This may be associated with nausea, vomiting, sweating, or difficulties walking. It is typically worsened when the head is moved. Vertigo is the most common type of dizziness. The most common diseases that result in vertigo are benign paroxysmal positional vertigo (BPPV), M√©ni√®re's disease, and labyrinthitis Less common causes include stroke, brain tumors, brain injury, multiple sclerosis, migraines, trauma, and uneven pressures between the middle ears. Physiologic vertigo may occur following being exposed to motion for a prolonged period such as when on a ship or simply following spinning with the eyes closed. Other causes may include toxin exposures such as to carbon monoxide, alcohol, or aspirin. Vertigo is a problem in a part of the vestibular system. Other causes of dizziness include presyncope, disequilibrium, and non-specific dizziness.

comments: Good information. Was waiting for the app on vertigo for ages. Now I have the information which you have given, I hope my vertigo gets controlled. Overall a nice job.

as 15-20 minutes at a time. Waiting for your eyes to uncross(like a 
Cyclops)in an empty parking lot waiting 20 minutes is not normal.

title: Foody - Food & Symptom Tracker
description:
Foody is your personal diary for keeping track of your food and symptoms you may experience from it. Once used for a couple of days Foody lets you analyze your diet and symptoms to assist you in understanding your health. The more you record, the better Foody can help you analyzing it. Therefor it was designed with focus on ease of use and simplicity rather than complicated forms. 

‚óä Record your Food
- Mark your meals as breakfast, lunch, dinner or just snacks and drinks in between.
- Solid food and drinks are separted for or a better overview. 
- No need to guess amounts or what not.
- Add unlimited ingredients for dishes and drinks.
- Add notes to your meals to include as mush details as you need.

‚óä Record Symptoms 
- Add symptoms by a concise title
- Use the intensity to keep track of how symptoms evolve.
- Add notes to include as mush details as you need to.

‚óä Input Helper
Entering the same over and over again is cumbersome. Foody helps you with a custom prediction. It suggests your most used symptoms, foods, drinks and even ingredients so entering common items is only a matter of seconds. 

‚óä Timeline / Overview 
- View and modify your diary entries in a beautiful timeline. 
- Apply filters to analyze and check any suspicion. 
- Filter to display only a custom period / date range.
- Filter food based on meal type and search term. 
- Choose to hide symptoms or filter by search term. 

‚óä Furthermore 
- No setup required: Foody is ready to record right away. No need to sign up, fill out stuff or create catalogs before. 
- All on your device: Everything is stored only on your device. No Cloud is involved at all. 
- Fully Offline: Since everything happens on your device without internet connection, it works where ever you go.

PLEASE NOTE: Foody is free to download and try out including all features. However, there are limitations which need to be unlocked once via In-App purchase for a serious use.

recentChanges: bug fixing
comments: Does the job. No frills (even though it could use a few) I bought the app, which seemed priced appropriately for what it does. I do hope to see some updates, maybe icon choices between breakfast, lunch and dinner to better distinguish between the three instead of the same icon. Maybe a choice of colors. A little bit would go a long way to making this app great.

A simple app for logging meals, with a pleasing design. But there should be a way to set the time to 12H instead of 24H. For instance my entry may say 2:15 PM, but when viewing the diary feed it's listed as 14:15. There are no settings or preferences. Also agree with another reviewer that a calendar view for jumping to specific days would be nice.

The free version only gives you a 7 day history. I'm in the middle of unpleasant intolerance symptoms so seeing my logs is imperative and my health depends on it. I don't want to bounce between a lot of apps or reenter info across them. Please consider another barrier, even ads. If I remember this app I might consider trying it when I'm not feeling sick, but this app is designed for sick people, so... It's a bummer because the interface is nice and you can't go wrong with googly eyes.
I downloaded it for the symptoms too, but there isnt a calendar view, and it only records 7 days before asking for a lot of money. I had to uninstall.

I use this to track my baby's symptoms as I am still breastfeeding and it works really well. I can add and edit things that I forgot and it's nice to have a scale of how bad the symptoms were for each event. The only thing I would love to see to improve it would be some sort of graph or chart as part of the report showing any patterns instead of having to read back through all of my entries to see if I can find any links.

title: CMSC Meetings
description:
CMSC is the official mobile app for the Annual Meeting of the Consortium of Multiple Sclerosis Centers.

This mobile app allows you to:
a.	View schedules, explore sessions, and find networking events.
b.	Create your own personal schedule for easy conference attendance.
c.	Access location and speaker information at your fingertips.
d.	Post updates to sessions, keynotes, and exhibitor booths.
e.	Interact with a real-time feed of all event activity, that showcases which sessions are trending, most popular photos, and popular discussion topics.
f.  Expand your professional network and have fun!

Features of the App:
a.	Update - a quick way to share photos, comments, and which session you‚Äôre attending
b.	Activity Feed - the real-time pulse of the event. See what people are saying, view photos from the event, and find trending sessions and topics.
c.	Agenda - view the full agenda and related information (session time, room number, speaker info, etc)
d.	Users - see who‚Äôs at the event, and connect with them on the app
e.	Exhibitors - find exhibitors and sponsors, and leave comments or ratings

Enjoy the app and have a great meeting!

title: Breast Cancer Healthline
description:
Whether you‚Äôre facing a diagnosis, going through treatment or in remission, Breast Cancer Healthline is the app to have in your pocket whenever you need it. We want you to feel like you‚Äôre not on this journey alone. At Healthline it‚Äôs our mission to connect you to people just like you, who get it. From 1:1 messaging to participating in our six group discussions, there are lots of easy ways to connect with the community. Breast Cancer Healthline is your safe place to share your story, give and receive advice, seek and offer support, and discover the latest news and research information. 

We don‚Äôt want you to feel defined by your disease. Breast Cancer Healthline offers a safe and diverse support system that allows you to be the whole you. 
 
HOW IT WORKS

Match: 
We connect you with a new member from our community each day at 12pm PST. We introduce you to members based on your stage, treatment and lifestyle interests. Browse member profiles and request to match with any member from our community. See members online now to instantly message.

Message: 
Easy access to all your member messages in one place. See your matches who are online now and message right away. Get notified when a member messages you. 

Groups:
Join the discussion in one of our Groups -- a great way to share stories while meeting other in the community. Each day our Breast Cancer Healthline Guide leads a new discussion in one of our Groups: 
Treatment
Lifestyle
Career
Relationships
Newly diagnosed
Living with stage 4

Discover:
Discover the best lifestyle and news content medically reviewed by Healthline medical professionals. Navigate articles about diagnosis, surgery and treatment. Explore clinical trials and the latest breast cancer research. Find ways to nurture your body through wellness, self care, and mental health information. Relate to others through personal stories and testimonials about their breast cancer journey. 

ABOUT HEALTHLINE
 
Healthline Media is the 2nd largest and fastest growing consumer health publisher in the world, reaching 85 million people a month. Healthline‚Äôs mission is to be your most trusted ally in your pursuit of health and well-being.
You can depend on us to provide expert content along with genuine caring. We will support, guide, and inspire you toward the best possible health outcomes for you and your family. Our solid profitability and rapid growth enables us to invest in expanding our reach and offering to have even more impact on many millions more users.

Breast Cancer Healthline is optimized for OS 6.0 and above.

comments: After sharing my journey the first time with others on this app I was made to feel so welcomed. There were so many positive notes of encouragement that I just felt my anxiety and nervousness just easing out my body. Thank you. I know there are others who feel the way I did.

I downloaded the app and was talking with other women and itv as helpful. The next day I tried to go on and it wouldn't open except to the first title page that is pink and says BC healthline. Very annoying. I'm already anxious about having breast cancer and now I can't even talk to the women I talked to yesterday.
It relieved a lot of stress giving me hope and expectations of outcomes knowing I am stronger than I think..love this app. ..Thanks
Great wealth of knowledge and support.

I tried to sign up on this app numerous times but everytime it showed some problem. I had very high hopes with this app but completely disappointed with it as I couldn't even sign up on it. Waste of time and hope. Extremely disappointing!

title: Diseases Dictionary & Treatments Offline
descriptionHTML:
Diseases Treatments Dictionary Offline is complete OFFLINE and FREE app containing list of Medical disorders & diseases that provides all information about symptoms, disorder and treatment and many medical terminology.
This is a Medical Dictionary hand book can act as a clinical advisor for self diagnosis and can also be used to look up symptoms, diseases and treatment. Medical dictionary free download is like a FREE Doctor at home for common diseases and treatment codes.

Optimized for TABLET devices.

Diseases Dictionary - Medical App Features:
1. Offline ‚Äì It wok offline, no active internet connection is required;
2. Detailed description of all major medical conditions and diseases:
- definition;
- symptoms;
- causes;
- risk factors;
- complications;
- preparing for your appointment;
- tests and diagnosis;
- treatments and drugs;
- lifestyle and home remedies

3. Easily find needed disease with instant search.
4. Favorites list‚Äì you are able to bookmark the Disease item to your favorites list by clicking on the ‚Äústar‚Äù icon.

Who can use this dictionary:
Healthcare professionals, pharmaceuticals, physicians, hospital nurses, medical students, nursing professionals, pharmacy, physician assistants and for students who work in clinical practice & dispensary.
summary: wiki of medical diseases treatment dictionary, offline and free
recentChanges:
update android api
fix app stabilization
comments: Really good and covers many conditions. I have the paid version without ads and it was worth every penny, I find this very useful when needing to look up a conditions and it is very detailed If you are a medical practitioner this will be a great aid
Thanks very much for creating this app. It's a very useful app. I learn many things from it. The only little problem is the ads. There are bunch of them. But overall this is a good app.
One of the best apps, good definitions and very easy to use
A splash screen comes up, and won't let quit the app, until you agree to review the app. Unacceptable!
Fant√°stic app. Very useful and well organized.

title: Medical Dictionary
description:
The Medical Dictionary contains detailed definitions on all diseases like migraine, headache & diabetes.

 It is a useful health dictionary for you to quickly find information on medical terms. The medical dictionary covers terminology of over 16,000 healthcare words including diseases, medical jargon, and abbreviations.

It provides quick access to hard-to-spell and often misspelled medical definitions through an extensive alphabetical listing.


====== Features ======
- The medical dictionary covers 16,0000+ pharmacy words & terminologies.
- Quickly learn medical vocabulary and the definition.
- Health & medical reference book and thesaurus covering all pharmacy abbreviations and terminologies.
- Completely offline medical dictionary (no internet connection required); 
- Large database of medical terminologies, medical vocabulary;
- A very fast word finder for medical terms
- Discover new medical terms and learn words to increase knowledge with your pocket thesaurus;
- Abbreviations offline app that work very efficient, fast and good performance.

In this offline medical dictionary you will find explanations of diseases like:
 Hemophilia:  Hemophilia is one of a group of inherited bleeding disorders that cause abnormal or exaggerated bleeding and poor blood clotting.
Deep vein thrombosis:  The two types of veins in the extremities are called superficial and deep ,  A blood clot in the deep veins is a concern because it can be dangerous.
Mesothelioma:  Mesothelioma is a cancer that arises from the cells lining the chest or abdominal cavities
migraine :  a powerful headache that often happens with nausea, vomiting, and sensitivity to light.
headache:  a pain arising from the head or upper neck of the body.
Lung cancer:  Lung cancer is the number one cause of cancer deaths in both men and women in the U.S. and worldwide , Cigarette smoking is the principal risk factor for development of lung cancer.
Head lice:  Head lice are parasites that are found on human heads. The word lice is plural for louse.
Multiple sclerosis:  Multiple sclerosis (MS) is a disease in which your immune system attacks the protective sheath (myelin) that covers your nerves.
Psoriasis:  Psoriasis is a chronic inflammatory skin disease , Patients with psoriasis who are obese are predisposed to diabetes and heart disease.
Rheumatoid arthritis:  Rheumatoid arthritis is an autoimmune disease that can cause chronic inflammation of the joints and other areas of the body.
Arrhythmia:  When the heart's electrical system malfunctions, the normal rhythm of the heart can be affected.
Gingivitis:  Gingivitis is a common and mild form of gum disease (periodontal disease) that causes irritation.
Type 2 diabetes: Diabetes is a chronic condition associated with abnormally high levels of sugar (glucose) in the blood.
Ulcerative colitis:  Ulcerative colitis is an inflammatory bowel disease (IBD) that causes long-lasting inflammation in part of your digestive tract.


Very useful for medical students, doctors, healthcare professionals, pharmaceuticals, physicians, hospital nurses, nursing professionals, pharmacy, physician helpers and for those who practice in clinical & dispensary.

title: Pill Reminder & Medication Tracker - MyTherapy
description:
MyTherapy is an ad-free, award-winning pill reminder and medication tracker. But MyTherapy is more than a free medication reminder: Combining a pill tracker, mood tracker and a health journal, e.g. with a weight tracker, this medication reminder app allows you and your doctor to put your treatment‚Äôs success into perspective. ‚è∞ üíäüîî

üíäKey Features 
‚Ä¢ Pill reminder app for all medications
‚Ä¢ Pill tracker with logbook for skipped and confirmed intakes
‚Ä¢ Support for wide range of dosing schemes within medication reminder
‚Ä¢ Track your tablets, dose, measurements, activities as a comprehensive health journal
‚Ä¢ Family sharing
‚Ä¢ Share your printable health journal with your doctor
‚Ä¢ Personalized tips for your treatment
‚Ä¢ Wide range of measurements for all conditions (diabetes, rheumatoid arthritis, anxiety, depression, hypertension, multiple sclerosis) e.g. weight, blood pressure, blood sugar levels

‚è∞Comprehensive meds reminder 
We designed a medicine reminder app that puts all your medication needs in one place: Pill reminders (e.g. for birth control pills), a comprehensive database of OTC and Rx medications, support for any dosage form (tablet, pill, inhalation, ‚Ä¶) frequency, and even refill reminders. And as the app is not only a pill alarm, but also a medication tracker, you just need to check its pill diary to make sure you‚Äôve taken that important dose. 

üíäA health tracker for your needs 
MyTherapy is the result of us closely working with people taking medications. People with diabetes use the built-in weight tracker and keep track of their blood glucose. Also, they use it as logbook for insulin and a medication reminder for Metformin etc. The built-in mood tracker supports you to keep track of your mental health or depression. Review your health using the blood pressure log, your mood diary or other aspects of your health journal. MyTherapy can be a different app to many, with some using it as depression app while others refer to it as stroke app, cancer app, or weight tracker.

‚è∞A tracker for mood, weight, blood pressure and more 
You can not only log your meds, but also track your mood and general well-being in the app‚Äôs mood diary. Record measurements e.g. blood pressure and weight. If you are living with diabetes and are on Insulin, you can use MyTherapy as diabetes logbook and track blood glucose. Overall, MyTherapy supports ~50 measurements. The app‚Äôs symptom tracker is popular e.g. with users living with multiple sclerosis, rheumatoid arthritis or cardiovascular diseases such as Atrial Fibrillation.

üíäMotivation to take your meds
Receive a beautiful picture of the day as motivation to take your medicine. Involve family and friends with MyTherapy Team and successfully manage together. And you can even have your family see if you‚Äôve missed a med despite the pill reminder, so they can help you stay on track.
MyTherapy is for you, no matter if you are taking antibiotic medicines or deal with hypertension, atrial fibrillation, diabetes, rheumatoid arthritis, multiple sclerosis, anxiety or depression that are often complicated. MyTherapy is medication tracker and health journal. Have peace of mind from medicine reminders and health tracker.

üîíPrivacy
MyTherapy is available for free and no registration is required! We comply with strict European privacy laws and do not release personal data to third parties. 

üîéResearch
It‚Äôs the collaborative efforts from users, their families and medical experts that makes our pill tracker app so simple. Check out our academic research partners on our homepage.

We are constantly aiming to improve the MyTherapy app to best meet your meds tracker needs and desires. Support us with your ideas, suggestions and feedback - either right from the app or via support@mytherapyapp.com. 

https://www.mytherapyapp.com

recentChanges: Thanks for using MyTherapy. Your feedback means the world to us. If you run into issues or have suggestions, please email us at support@mytherapyapp.com. We are working hard to make MyTherapy even better. If you gave us less than 5 stars, an update of your review is highly appreciated.
comments: Such a great & easy to use app. It's organised & kept me on top of all my medication intakes & I love the inspiring photos each day. Only 2 niggles I have is the reminder popping up over my navigation app whilst I'm driving (although I'm sure I can sort that if I look into my settings) & that I can't save those gorgeous daily pics to my gallery; I can only do it by screenshot but again, that's probably me not spending enough time figuring that out.

UPDATE Actually getting WORSE. Loses everything. Wow get out of tracking RX if you can't make this accurate. Dangerous. Started OUT ok. However it loses track of input for mornings sometimes. So I record the medication time given along with symptoms I track. When I go back in evening for twice a day medications it will show nothing entered for morning on some days. TERRIBLE if accuracy is important. It has gotten worse lately, so maybe it doesn't work with the latest ver of ANDROID

Great, but wish the symptom tracker had more. I'm using this to track my menieres medication and symptoms and it's not accommodated. It's not a rare disease, so unsure why. Please include tinnitus, dizziness, and vertigo in symptoms. Or the ability to type in my own.

Great remeinder app for my medications. i love the fact that it reminds you to take your meds, and the reminder doesnt go away until you check it off. i can be forgetful at times and this helps so much! Thanks for the great app

Meditation list missing meds. Doesn't have a way to record insulin shots. Doesn't seem to have a way to print or email medication or dose info to my doctor. Really could use some sort of manual or built in instructions. I was hoping for more. Very disappointed.

title: MS Ready
description:
Use MS Ready to keep informed of public health and safety emergencies throughout Mississippi.

Features of this app include:
‚Ä¢	Push, text or email notification of real-time emergency alerts to keep you aware of potential emergencies and hazards
‚Ä¢	Learn about emergencies, natural disasters and what you can do to safely prepare
‚Ä¢	Available offline are important MS Department of Health phone numbers and an emergency hotline
‚Ä¢	Complete an emergency checklist of items to have on hand should an emergency arise
‚Ä¢	Connect to MSDH twitter, facebook and youtube pages within the app
